loans.name: Sanata

texts.fr: Madame Sanata est âgée de  59  ans environ, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle réside dans la ville de Koutiala chez son époux. Elle  n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école, raison pour laquelle elle s’est basée sur le commerce depuis à bas âge. Elle exerce cette activité (préparation et vente de Sounbala) depuis plusieurs années, le Sounbala est l’un des condiments essentiels des femmes Maliennes. Elle est très sollicitée par sa clientèle, car elle reçoit des commandes importantes à travers le sous régions du Mali, pour cela cette activité est beaucoup prometteuse. Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et élargir son activité, Elle a sollicité le partenariat avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de 8 ans. Elle a déjà bénéficié des prêts dans le groupe (prêt solidaire) et elle est à son 6ème prêt  individuel dont les précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 15 sacs de 100Kg de soja auprès des stockeurs de céréales de Koutiala, elle effectue sa vente après transformation du soja en Sounbala  à Koutiala, Bamako et Kayes, à une clientèle constituée de femmes généralement, au comptant et souvent à crédit. Avec ce prêt elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000FCFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le remboursement de son prêt, contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs, Sanata is about 59 years old. She's married and the mother of six children. She lives in Koutiala with her husband. She never had a chance to attend school, which is why she's been relying on trade since her youngest age.

She's been preparing and selling "Soumbala" (a condiment made out of beans, widely-used in West Africa). She's very much in demand from her clientele, and gets important orders from many different parts of Mali. Her business is therefore very promising.

To increase her working capital in order to meet customer demand and expand her business, she joined Kiva' partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, eight years ago. She already benefited from group loans (solidarity loans) and is now seeking her sixth personal loan. Previous loans were repaid without problems.

With this loan, she intends to buy fifteen 100 kg sacks of soy from cereals warehouses in Koutiala. She transforms the soy into "Soumbala" that she sells in Koutiala, Bamako and Kayes, for cash and often on credit, to a clientele comprising mostly women.

With this loan, she counts on a monthly profit of XOF 100'000 (ca US$ 200) that she intends to use to repay the loan and help improve her family's standard of living. She will reinvest the remainder in her business.

loans.use: to buy soy

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru:
Джамшед жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 34 лет. Он женат и имеет одного ребёнка. Со своей семьёй Джамшед живёт в маленьком посёлке. Он очень любит природу и животных, поэтому занимается видом бизнеса, который ему по душе. Джамшед разводит скот, выращивает их и продаёт. Этот бизнес приносит ему стабильный доход.
 Жена Джамшеда нигде не работает, у неё достаточно хлопот по дому. А в свободное время она помогает мужу ухаживать за скотом. Соседи Джамшеда также занимаются животноводством и неподалёку от посёлка имеется большое пастбище, где все они могут пасти своих скот. Все соседи помогают друг другу в этом деле.
 Также Джамшед имеет дополнительный доход, он водит трактор и предоставляет услуги тракториста. У Джамшеда подрастает сын и скоро ему нужно будет поступать в Университет для получения высшего образования. Поэтому сейчас Джамшед желает увеличить свой бизнес, чтобы иметь достаточный доход для обеспечения своего сына. Он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит для покупки нескольких голов рогатого скота. Джамшед надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Jamshed is a cheerful man of 44. He is married and has one child. He lives with his family in a small village. He loves nature and animals, and so he is engaged in the type of business that appeals to him. He breeds livestock, raises the animals, and then sells them. This brings provides him with a stable income.

Jamshed's wife does not have a job; she is busy enough at home. In her spare time she helps her husband tend the animals. All of the neighbors help each other in this business.

Jamshed earns additional income driving a tractor. His son is growing up and will soon need to enter the University. So now Jamshed wants to expand his business to earn enough to pay for son's education. He has turned to Arvand for a loan to buy several head of cattle. Jamshed is counting on a positive response and thanks Arvand in advance for its support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is married with six children. Although she has received no prior formal education, she is an entrepreneur who sells rice in Enyaadze, near Cape Coast. Abena has run her business for the past three years. Her husband is a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Abena is requesting a loan to buy more rice to sell to increase her business. In the long term, she plans to reinvest her future profits into her business to help her expand and meet rising customer demand.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Zoumana

texts.fr:
Agé de 42 ans environ, Zoumana a deux épouses et est père de 3 enfants. Il vit  avec sa famille dans la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso).  Dû à des raisons sociales, Zoumana n’a pas eu la chance d’être instruit  raison pour laquelle il s’est basé sur les  activités  génératrices de revenus  depuis à bas âges. Il excelle dans les  activités d’achat et de vente des articles de boutique et de céréales qui lui procure assez de revenus, car il reçoit beaucoup de clients par jour. Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’agrandissement de son activité, il a fait recours à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso  depuis plus 5 ans.  Il est à son 8ème prêt  individuel dont les précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté. Ce prêt sera  utilisé pour l’acquisition d’un stock de  diverses marchandises (huile alimentaire, sacs de sucre, de sel de cuisine, de lait en poudre, cartons de thé, et des sacs de céréale. Il s’approvisionne auprès  des grossistes de Koutiala et effectue sa vente dans sa boutique à une clientèle mixte au comptant. 
Avec le renforcement de son fonds  de roulement, il compte réaliser un  bénéfice mensuel de 150.000 FCFA  qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement de son prêt, satisfaire les besoins de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Zoumana, age 42, has two spouses and is the father of three children. He lives with his family in Koutiala (Sikasso Region). For social reasons, he didn't get the chance to receive an education, which is why he's been relying on money-earning businesses since his younger age.

He excels in buying and selling store products and cereals, a business which provides him with enough income, because he has a lot of customers every day.

To ensure his clientele is satisfied and expand his business, he joined Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, five years ago. He's seeking his eighth personal loan. The previous ones were repaid without problems.

This loan will be used to buy a stock of various products (cooking oil, sacks of sugar, cooking salt, powdered milk, boxes of tea, and sacks of cereals). He gets his supplies from wholesalers in Koutiala, and sells at his shop, for cash, to a mixed-gender clientele.

After increasing his working capital, he intends to turn a monthly profit of XOF 150'000 (ca US$ 300), to be used to repay the loan and provide for the needs of his family. The remainder will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, salt, powdered milk, tea, and cereals

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a married woman and a mother of seven children. She has been an animal trader for many years. Shehnaz initiated her business by buying animals to support her family. When she began, her husband was the only breadwinner in the family. Shehnaz buys baby goats and baby cows at low prices, rears them, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. With the passage of time, Shehnaz's sales and income have increased. This expansion has happened due to her courage and determination. Shehnaz is respected in her home because of her work, and she helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She is in her third loan cycle with Kashf Foundation. 

Shehnaz is requesting a  35,000 PKR loan to add to her savings and purchase another cow. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands. Shehnaz is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Adiza

texts.en:
Adiza is a single mother with six children. Due to difficult circumstances, she did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. For the past three years, Adiza has sold palm oil in Enyaadze, near Cape Coast. She uses all of her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Adiza is requesting a loan to purchase an increased amount of palm fruits to improve her overall sales. She wants to use the profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase palm fruits

loans.name: Margrait

texts.en:
Margrait is a 46-year-old married woman who successfully runs a general store with her son. The man shown in the photo with her is Margrait’s son who helps her by buying goods from the market at wholesale rates. They have six years of experience in this field and have a regular list of customers. 

Margrait is requesting a 30,000 PKR loan to buy packets of salt, sugar, cooking oil, biscuits, and beverages to meet customer demand. She is in her second loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and she wants to expand her business to meet demand. Margrait will use part of the profit from her loan to cover her personal expenses and increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy packets of salt, sugar, cooking oil, biscuits, and beverages

loans.name: Jaime Gonzalo

texts.es:
Jaime de 31 años de edad, inició su negocio dedicado a la venta de medicamentos desde hace ocho meses debido a la necesidad carente en su sector. Oportunidad que aprovechó para crear empresa y mejorar sus ingresos. Laboró por  más de 12 años administrando un almacén de medicamentos, empleo que le permitió aprender y adquirir la experiencia que hoy lo han llevado a ser independiente. Se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la adecuación de vitrinas y compra de surtido con el fin de aumentar sus ventas y lograr posicionarse dentro del mercado local.
Sueña con garantizarle a su familia una estabilidad económica y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jaime is thirty-one years old.  He began his business selling medicines eight months ago because of the need for this service in his neighborhood.  He took advantage of this opportunity to create a business and increase his income.  He had worked for more than twelve years managing a medical shop, a job that allowed him to learn and acquire experience.  Today, this has allowed him to be independent.  

He is requesting a loan that he will invest in purchasing display cabinets and restocking his busines, with the final goal being to grow his sales and to position himself within the local market.

He dreams of being able to guarantee a stable economic income and better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy display cabinets and restock his business.

loans.name: Rahat

texts.en:
Rahat is 32 and works at home as a tailor. She started this line of work a year ago and now she is proud to be contributing to her household income. When she was not earning, Rahat's family was going through a severe financial crisis which compelled her to begin to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her hard work has helped establish a good clientele, but she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. 

Rahat is requesting a 20,000 PKR loan through the Kashf Foundation to purchase spools of threads and packs of buttons, laces, and zippers in various colors. She hopes to increase in her income by fulfilling her orders on time.

loans.use: to purchase thread and packs of buttons, laces, and zippers

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is single and has three children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, she is a successful businesswoman who sells fried fish in Enyaadze, near Cape Coast. Esi has been actively involved in her business for about 30 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, she uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Esi is requesting a loan to purchase increased amounts of fish to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells to adapt to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase fish

loans.name: Marlon Rodolfo

texts.es: El joven Marlon, es emprendedor, luchador y muy humilde desde pequeño su padre le ha inculcado el trabajo a la tierra, habita en el  municipio de Ticuantepe en  la zona de las Dispersas, en la semana trabaja junto a su padre y demas hermanos en la cosecha de Cafe, los fines de semana se dedica a estudiar ya que su mayor sueño es ser un profesional en la vida, con este credito comprara insumos necesarios para atacar la plaga que asecha  sus cultivos ademas necesita de Fertilizantes y Abono para aprovechar la lluvia y que su Cafe sea de calidad. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en:
This young man, Marlon, is an enterprising, fighting and very humble person.  Since he was young, his father has taught him to work the land.  He lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe, in the area known as Dispersas.  During the week, he works together with his father and other brothers in the coffee harvest.  On the weekends, he is dedicated to studying.  His greatest life dream is to become a professional.

With this loan, he will buy the necessary supplies to combat the pests that attack his crops.  He also needs fertilizers and manure in order to take advantage of the rains.  These things will make quality coffee.  

He is thankful for the support that Afodenic and Kiva have offered him.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Jose Vidal

texts.es:
José, requiere de un nuevo préstamo porque necesita de mas capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en el cultivo de granos básicos; este le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas y arrendamiento de la tierra.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus inventarios y obtener mayores ingresos; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan because he needs more working capital to continue investing in his basic grain crops.  This loan will allow him to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides and insecticides.  He will also pay rental on his land.

José's previous loan helped him to increase his stock and make more income.  His family and financial situations have improved greatly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides and insecticides, and to pay rent on his land

loans.name: Bintsalim

texts.en:
Bintisalim is married with four children who attend school. Her husband is employed at Kenya Ports Authority. Bintisalim and her husband work hard to provide for their family. She runs a well-stocked grocery store that she worked hard to set up. Bintisalim works from very early in the morning. Thanks to their joint work, she and her husband are providing their children with an education and are able to buy household necessities.

Bintisalim is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her store such as drinks, vegetables, fruit, and other basic products so that she can continue giving her customers everything they need.

loans.use: to buy drinks, vegetables, fruit, and other basic products

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is 29 years old and has four children. It was very hard for her to manage her children's needs with her husband's small income, so she decided to help her husband and earn an income. Balqees started a clothing business four years ago. She buys different varieties of clothing from the Lahore and Faisalabad markets and sells them in her area. Balqees now plays a very important role in her family. 

Balqees is requesting a 35,000 PKR loan through the Kashf Foundation to purchase summer clothing in different designs and sizes. She hopes that her loan will increase her sales. Balqees is in her fourth loan cycle and has successfully repaid her previous loans. She hopes to increase her net income with her sales and will spend part of her income to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase summer clothing in different designs and sizes

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es una persona de 42 años de edad, unido,  tiene 2 hijas, ambas maestras de educación,  el y su familia viven en la Aldea Chuisantotomás, municipio de Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan, departamento de Sololá.
El es agricultor, se dedica al cultivo y venta de banano y café. El cultivo de  estos productos lo realiza en su parcela ubicada en la comunidad donde vive. La venta tanto del banano como del café lo realiza en el mercado municipal de Santo Tomás La Unión, Suchitepéquez. Don Miguel se dedica a esta actividad debido a que los precios son buenos, lo que le genera aceptables ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Tiene 22 años de estar realizando esta actividad.
El está  solicitando un préstamo de Q 8,000.00 para compra de fertilizante y pago de mano de obra para el mantenimiento del cultivo de café y banano.
Su sueño más importante es comprar más terreno y  sembrar más  banano y café para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Miguel is 42 years old, married and has two daughters who are both teachers.  He and his family live in the small village of Chuisantotomás, in Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan, Sololá department.

Miguel is a farmer who grows and sells bananas and coffee.  He grows these crops on a plot of land which is located in his community.  He sells both his bananas and his coffee in the town market in Santo Tomás La Unión, Suchitepéquez.  Miguel works in this business because the prices are good and he makes a decent income with which to support his family.  He has been in this business for 22 years.

Miguel is requesting a loan for 8,000 quetzals to buy fertilizer and to pay workers to maintain his coffee and banana crops.  His biggest dream is to buy more land and sow more bananas and coffee so that he can make more profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay workers to maintain his coffee and banana crops

loans.name: Otoniel

texts.es:
Otoniel, se decide por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de  trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en su oficio; este le permitirá comprar una vaca para producción de leche.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar sus inventarios  y obtener más ganado; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Otoniel is requesting a new loan because he needs more working capital to continue investing in his business.  This loan will allow him to buy a dairy cow.

Otoniel's previous loan helped him to increase his stock and to buy more cattle.  His family and financial situations have both improved.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is divorced and has three children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, she is a successful businesswoman. For the past four years, she has prepared and sold "kenkey," a traditional Ghanaian staple that is made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves. Aba normally sells her kenkey in Enyaadze, near Cape Coast. As the sole breadwinner in her family, she uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Aba is requesting a loan to purchase increased amounts of maize to aid her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her loan, she plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells to adapt to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase maize

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesús es un señor soltero de 71 años de edad quien actualmente tiene 3 hijos, los cuales son 1 hombre y 2 mujeres quienes viven en el Caserío Central, Aldea Xajaxac, Sololá.
El se dedica a la compraventa de  abarrotes  en su  comunidad donde tiene su tienda. Eligio esta actividad porque ya no puede trabajar en el campo como agricultor, atreves de la labor que realiza obtiene ingresos y ganancias para aportar a  la economía familiar.
El ha observado que las ganancias que le genera su negocio  son buenas de manera que esta solicitando un préstamo de Q 2,000.00 para ampliar su negocio de abarrotes y así ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Su sueño es tener un local grande, en donde pueda variar sus productos para su negocio y así incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Jesús, 71, is a single man with three children, one man and two women who live in Caserío Central, Aldea Xajaxac, Sololá.

He buys and sells groceries in his community where he has his store.  He chose this job because he was no longer able to work in the field as a farmer.  Through this job he makes income and profits to contribute to the family finances.

He has observed that the profits his business generates him are good, so he's requesting a loan for 2,000 quetzales [GTQ] to expand his grocery store and give better customer service.

His dream is to have a big locale where he can vary the products for his business and increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 36-year-old sole proprietor who bakes and owns an Mpesa shop in Kilifi Kenya. He is a married man who supports seven people in his family. He has been in this business for the last eight years and has done great.

This marks his third loan from KADET Ltd. to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase bales of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar and to top up his Mpesa float. He will use the anticipated profit to repay his loan. 

He hopes to grow his business and in future to own several Mpesa shops.

loans.use: to purchase bales of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar and to top up his Mpesa float.

loans.name: Geovanni Aristides

texts.es:
Geovanni, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en la tienda; este le permitirá comprar artículos de primera necesidad tales como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sal, aceite, galletas, entre otros productos para satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar su inventario de mercadería y su clientela asimismo; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
Geovanni needs to request a new loan because he needs more working capital to continue investing in his store.  This will allow him to buy staples such as rice, beans, sugar, salt, oil, cookies, and other products to satisfy the needs of his customers.

The previous loan helped him increase his merchandise inventory as well as his customers.  His financial condition and family circumstances have gotten better.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, salt, oil, cookies, and other products

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 38 year old vigorous lady. She has expertise in embroidery and has been using her skills to provide for her family for more than four years now. She started this line of work at a very young age. During the initial years of her business she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. Today she is proud to be famous in her community and to be the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads.  

She has been in association with Kashf Foundation for five years.  She has requested another loan worth Rs. 20,000 to purchase more spools of threads, the latest beads and sparkling material in different colors. She says that the women in her community are becoming more demanding with the passage of time and satisfying them is a challenge that Salma has taken up. She has five children and she is striving hard to provide them a better standard of living through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, the latest beads and sparkling material in different colors.

loans.name: Ana Lilian

texts.es:
Ana, requiere de un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio; este le permitirá comprar frutas y verduras tales como: manzanas, uvas, naranjas, cebollas, tomates, zanahorias, chiles, asimismo articulos de belleza, entre estos: perfumes, shampoo, cremas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus ingresos,  esto los invierte en el mejoramiento de la vivienda y gastos básicos del hogar; las condiciones económicas han mejorado y se encuentran muy bien de salud.
texts.en: Ana requires a new loan because she needs more working capital to keep investing in her business.  It will enable her to but fruit and vegetables such as: apples, grapes, oranges, onions, tomatoes, carrots and chillies, as well as beauty products including perfume, shampoo and lotions, among other things.  Her last loan helped her to increase her income which she then invested in improving her home and covering her basic household expenditure.  Her family's financial situation has improved and they are all in excellent health.

loans.use: to buy apples, grapes, oranges, onions, tomatoes, carrots and chillies, as well as perfume, shampoo and beauty creams, among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for palm oil and wood.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma, 48, has been engaged in the business of selling milk for about 20 years. She has five buffaloes and five cows in milk. She sells their milk to many of her neighbors, and she earns a good income, to contribute to the family income. She has two daughters and one son; all are school-going. She is highly motivated to provide them a beautiful life, with good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. This is her fourth year with Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business with its support. Now she has applied for a loan of PKR 5,000 to buy one more cow. She hopes to increase her earnings through her increased sales.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Rafeeqan

texts.en: Rafeeqan is a 38-year-old, married woman and the mother of seven children. She has been running a business of cloth sales for the past 5 years. She purchases a variety of cloths from the main city and then sells them to the people in her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Rafeeqan has requested a loan of PKR 50,000 from the Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloths for the summer season taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to attract more customers to increase her sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and will be able to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloths of the summer season.

loans.name: Khattar

texts.en: Khattar is a 33 year-old single man. He owns a vehicle garage in his town and has been working there for five years. He still hasn't found the woman of his dreams, but is working on that! In fact, he contacted Al Majmoua in order to acquire a loan to purchase furniture for the living room of his new house. It would help him with expenses and would push him to settle down and establish a family with his wife-to-be. Concerning the future, Khattar wishes to open up a larger garage soon.

loans.use: purchase furniture for the living room in his new house

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. 

Ten years ago she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. 

Due to lack of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she contacted Kashf Foundation for the second time and applied for a loan of PKR 30,000. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads and packs of laces, zippers and buttons in various colors. It will help her to complete the orders of her customers on time, which ultimately helps in generating more income for her. 

Shahida wishes to spend part of profits on the betterment of her three children.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads and packs of laces, zippers and buttons in various colors.

loans.name: Azhdar

texts.en:
Azhdar is 35 years old. He lives in the small village of Bolnisi District with his wife and parents. 

Azhdar has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family business start-ups, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from their agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of land, where haricot and wheat are grown. They sell the harvested products locally at a good price. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Azhdar requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Azhdar has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Azhdar will purchase calves. After purchasing the calves, he will raise them and then resell them at a higher price. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise and resell at a higher price.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: Kaneez is 44 years old, a vigorous married woman. She has been in business as a tailor for the past six years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed as a security guard in a factory, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. Kaneez’s sewing is very popular on her street, and she is the best earner of income in her household. She is the mother of five children and wants to grow her business. She applied for a loan of PKR 20,000, to buy a new sewing machine and some spools of thread and ribbons in various colors. She is in her second loan cycle, and she has a good repayment history. She shared her dream of opening a tailoring center for the girls of her village to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and some spools of thread and ribbons in various colors.

loans.name: Pengio Group

texts.en:
Pengio is a group of three Filipino ladies, Salvacion, Myrna, and Sunshine, who live in Lebanon and work as housekeepers for Lebanese families. They have been friends ever since they moved to Lebanon. They decided to join hands and form this group in order to acquire a group loan from Al Majmoua. 
Myrna is the group leader and the featured member of the group; she is the first from the right. She is a 46-year-old, the single mother of three children. Her children are still living in the Philippines and rely on their mother's salary to live through the month. The father of her children does not contribute to the financial needs of the family, which makes her the family’s only financial provider. For this reason, she needs the Al Majmoua loan to start a new business to earn extra income. She will start selling clothes, watches, silver and Brazilian gold, in order to be able to send extra money to her children, who sometimes have urgent spending needs. 
Salvacion is a 48-year-old, the married mother of three children. She is the one in the middle. Her husband is unemployed, which makes her too the only financial provider for the family. She needs the Al Majmoua loan to send it off to her family in the Philippines.
Sunshine is a young lady of 22. Her retired parents are in dire need of financial assistance. This is why she decided to apply for the Al Majmoua group loan.

loans.use: to start a new business selling clothes, watches, silver and Brazilian gold, to earn extra income.

loans.name: Matano

texts.en: Matano is borrowing his third loan to finance his business. He will purchase new plastic chairs for his expanded video show room and large speakers. He hopes to own a well established entertainment show room with modern equipment to attract more clients.

loans.use: to purchase new plastic chairs and large speakers.

loans.name: Rasoolan

texts.en:
Rasoolan is a 57-years-old married woman. She has been successfully running a general store at the corner of her house for the past two years. She is doing it with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Rasoolan's husband, who assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market. 

She is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is from Likoni, Kenya. She works selling fruits and vegetables in a little shed at the entrance to the city.

With sacrifice and dedication she has managed to improve the lives of her three children, with the help of her husband. She is a very hardworking woman. She says she has always worked and that she is not afraid of challenges. Her goal is to be able to continue growing her business and have a bigger shed to continue helping her family and her husband.

Mishi is coming to Yehu Microfinance and to Kiva to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, green peppers, carrots, and onions as well as seasonal fruit to be able to supply her business with top quality products.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, green peppers, carrots, and onions as well as seasonal fruit

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 31 year old married woman. She started her business of clothes selling eight years ago as her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet their household expenses alone. She purchases cloth in various designs and colors and after stitching them into clothes she sells them to the people of her vicinity. She is well familiar with stitching techniques and is expert in designing stylish clothes. In this way she is helping her husband financially and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. 

Currently, she has requested a loan of Rs 15,000 to buy bundles of cloth, spools of thread and ribbons in various colors. She will then be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to buy bundles of cloth, spools of thread and ribbons in various colors.

loans.name: Bendera

texts.en:
Bendera is 65 years old  and a retail shop proprietor in Mariakani, Kenya. She is a married woman who supports two children and has been in this business for the last three years and has done great.

This marks her fifth loan from KADET to finance her business. She will use the requested loan to purchase retail shop items such as bales of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat and sugar for her shop and will use the anticipated profit to service her loan. 

She hopes to have a successful and a happy family in future.

loans.use: to buy bales of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Alusine

texts.en:
This is 55-year-old Alusine. He is married and has three children, aged 5, 10 and 15. He has two additional dependents, who live with him as he is helping his wife's younger siblings with their education.  

In 2004, Alusine established his building material, metal windows and doors business. He began his business because wanted to be self-reliant after coming from the mines. His business is located in the city center, and his main customers are adults and builders. 

Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 1,777,125 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Alusine has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional PVC pipes, elbows, and cables. He hopes that this loan can increase the stock and add to the profit. 

In the future, Alusine plans to move from the tiny shop to a bigger shop and plans to open outlets within the town. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for PVC pipes, elbows, and cables.

loans.name: Mirna Lidia

texts.es:
Mirna es una señorita soltera de 37 años de edad quien vive con sus padres en el Sector IAN Tarrales, Aldea Chocola, San Pablo Jocopilas, Suchitepequez. 
Ella actualmente tiene una tienda de abarrotes en el lugar de su vivienda, la cual es una fuente de ingresos económicos para su familia. Inicio esta actividad hace 5 años, viendo la necesidad de su familia y la de sus vecinos de tener una tienda de abarrotes en su comunidad. 
Ella está  solicitando un préstamo de Q 10,000.00 para comprar más productos y ampliar su tienda de abarrotes, de este modo ella puede brindarles un  mejor servicio a sus clientes y obtener mejores ganancias para mantener a su familia.
Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y ampliarlo para colocar otra clase de productos.
texts.en:
Mirna, 37, is single and lives with her parents in the IAN Tarrales area of the town of Chocola in San Pablo Jocopilas, Suchitepequez.

Currently she has a grocery store in her house that's a source of income for her family.  She started this job five years ago, seeing that her family and neighbors needed a grocery store in their community.

She's requesting a loan for 10,000 quetzales [GTQ] to buy more products and expand her grocery store.  This way she can give better customer service and earn more income to support her family.

Her dream is to improve her business and expand it with other products.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Leibys Janeth

texts.es:
Leibys de 29 años y madre de dos hijos menores de edad, labora diariamente desde las 4:00 am. Iniciando su faena en la plaza mayorista en donde se abastece de legumbres y frutas para comercializar en la plaza de mercado de su localidad y en municipios aledaños. 
Cuenta que este negocio lo inició su madre, quien sufrió una trombosis, enfermedad que le impidió seguir ejerciendo la actividad y por lo cual Leibys decidió hacerse cargo. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtidos y adecuaciones locativas, con el propósito de mejorar su condición económica y brindarle a su medre e hijos una calidad de vida digna.
texts.en:
Leibys, 29, has two underage children. She works every day, starting at 04:00 am. She starts her daily tasks by visiting the wholesale market and buying vegetables and fruits, to later sell them in her locality’s marketplace and in surrounding municipalities. Liebys says that her mother started this business. She later had a thrombotic stroke, which made it impossible for her to continue working. This is why Leibys took over.

She is today requesting a loan to buy supplies and to make some improvements to her establishment. With this, she expects to improve her economic situation and give her mother and children a dignified life.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables and make some improvements to her establishment.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
This marks Philip's fourth borrowing to finance his business by buying a variety of foodstuffs, new chairs, tables and serving dishes. He has expanded his food kiosk and also built a traditional kiln where he can keep the roasted meat waiting for the clients.

His sales have since improved and hence he has leased a cooler to help him serve his clients with cold soft drinks. He will use the profit to open up a second eatery in the nearby bus stop and hopes to excel in his business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of foodstuffs, new chairs, tables and serving dishes.

loans.name: Majeeda

texts.en: Majeeda is a 43-year-old married woman; she and her husband have been engaged in the business of selling milk for many years. She has five buffaloes in milk and sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk. She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them, while her husband sells it in different places on daily basis. They are happily doing this together to support their family. She has three daughters and two sons, three of whom go to school. She needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures, including food, clothing and education expenses. In order to make huge profits, she applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy one more buffalo to increase her sales. She is in her sixth loan cycle; she hopes to achieve an increase in her milk production capacity, which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo for her dairy business.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en: Sauda is married, and they have four children. Sauda is a street vendor who sells women's, men's and children's clothing and shoes. She has been in business since 2009. Through their respective jobs, both contribute toward household expenses, in their effort to get ahead. Sauda is applying for a loan to buy shirts, blouses, jeans, and sport shoes for women, men and children. This will allow her to have a wider variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, jeans, and sport shoes for women, men and children, for her business as a street vendor.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 42-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She is in the business of making costume jewelry, with the support of her husband. The business has great potential for growth, and Parveen is actively helping her husband, as this business is their only source of income. She wants to send her children to a school with high standards, by trying to increase her earnings. In order to meet orders on time and boost her sales, Parveen applied for a loan of PKR 15,000 to buy raw materials, such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls. She is in her fifth loan cycle, and she has a good repayment history. She hopes to increase her net income and wishes to spend part of the profits on providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials, such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls, for her business of making costume jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food for his business

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 21-year-old man living with his parents and four siblings. 

He is the owner of electric extension services in his village, and he has been working in this domain for eight years now. He is the major financial source of the family since he earns more than three quarters of the total family monthly income. This means that his family relies heavily on him to provide food, shelter and other needs. 

He contacted Al Majmoua hoping to apply for a youth loan that would alleviate his burdens. He needs to purchase electric components for his business, and for his house. 

He is the only member of the family who is able to pay off the loan. As for his future career plans, Hussein hopes to expand the business he is doing.

loans.use: to purchase necessary electric components for his business and his house.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is from Likoni, Kenya. She is divorced and has two children who are still too young for school. 

Mejumaa has a small grocery store where she supplies her neighbors and casual customers, providing them with the best prices, with a quality and variety of products. She is a very hard-working and unassuming lady who has been working with Yehu Microfinance for the past year. She is very grateful for the trust they have placed in her.

Mejumaa is requesting this loan to buy drinks, sugar, rice, noodles, dairy products and other supplies she needs to stock her business. This will allow her to keep working.

loans.use: to buy drinks, sugar, rice, noodles, dairy products and other supplies she needs to stock her business.

loans.name: Makuu

texts.en:
This marks Makuu's third borrowing to finance his business. The business has expanded and he will buy more bales of shoes and belts for sale. 

His previous loans have been serviced successfully and he hopes to excel in his business and life.

loans.use: buy more bales of shoes and belts for sale.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is from Likoni, Kenya. She is a married woman and has five children all of whom attend school. She has a fruit and vegetable stand at the market in Likoni. Thanks to the high quality of products that she offers, she has been able to establish a good customer base and earn a good income. She says that she strives to move forward so that she can generate a little more income and have a retirement that is problem-free.


Asha is requesting a loan to buy seasonal fruits such as melons, watermelons, grapes, and other types of products so that she can restock her inventory and meet the demand of her customers. She is grateful to Yehu Microfinance and Kiva for the opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits such as melons, watermelons, grapes, and other types of products.

loans.name: Maya Group

texts.en:
MAYA is a group composed of four Filipino ladies who work as housekeepers for Lebanese families. They have been friends ever since they met in Lebanon. They decided to form the Maya group and contact Al Majmoua because they are in dire need of financial assistance and a group loan is their last hope. 

Sionida is the leader and featured member of this group, standing on the far right of the picture. She is a 47 year-old married mother of one child. Her husband and child are still living in the Philippine, but her husband is currently unemployed. Thus, she is the only financial provider of the family, although she lives thousands of kilometers away. She decided to join the Maya group in order to acquire the group loan with the support of her friends, and send it off to her family.

Jennifer is  a 25 year-old young lady who is still single, standing on the far left of the picture. Her parents are retired which means she participates greatly in the family income. She decided to join the group and acquire a loan because her mother is in the hospital and has to pay the hospitalization fees.

Arlyn is a 36 year-old single woman, standing second to the left of the picture. Her family really depends on her salary in order to get through the month. She decided to join the Maya group because she needs the loan in order to send it off to her sister.

Shella is a 31 year-old single lady, whose parents are retired, standing second to the right of the picture. Her family needs an urgent amount of money, which is why she decided to acquire the loan and send it off to her family.

loans.use: to send the money to her family

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima lives with her husband who is a businessman and has been a member of the Yehu Microfinance since 2011. She buys and sells coal and gas pouches for a living.

She started her business with a wooden wheelbarrow, which she still owns. Over time she has purchased other work tools, eventually acquiring an open motorcar for her sales activity and product delivery to customers. The problem was that rainy days posed inconveniences. She now has bought another motorcar, covered this time, so she can deliver products, come rain or shine.

She is requesting a loan to buy coal to fill customer orders.

loans.use: to buy coal to fill customer orders.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg is a student from Yerevan. He studies at Armenian State Economic University in the department of statistics. Gevorg lives with his mother and is the only breadwinner of the family (he works at Ministry of Emergency Situations as a redeemer).

With a good credit history behind him (with his previous loan from SEF, he paid for the tuition fee for the first semester) Gevorg has applied for this loan to pay for his university tuition for the second semester. The loan is very important for Gevorg so that he may continue his education and get his diploma.
Gevorg waits for your support.

loans.use: to pay university tuition for the second semester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for hair product and toiletries.

loans.name: Abu Bakarr

texts.en:
This is 53-year-old Abu Bakarr. He is married and has five children aged 4, 6, 8, 12 and 17. He has three additional dependents, who live with him because he is helping his nephews with their education.  

In 2001, Abu Bakarr established his used shoes business. He began his business as an expansion of his wife's business. His business is located in the city center, and his main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 1,063,800 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Abu Bakarr has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and now requires a new loan in order to pay for an additional five bales of men's shoes. He hopes that this loan can increase the stock and raise the profit. In the future, Abu Bakarr hopes to grow the business and to be able to make enough so that could take care of the children's education. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for five bales of men's used shoes.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 53 year-old married father of three children. He has a garage where he conducts metal work and painting. He has been working in this field for 35 years now. His wife is unemployed, which renders him as the only financial provider of the family. His income is not enough to provide for his wife and three children. 

The highest education his parents could afford to give him was elementary school which has narrowed his scope of opportunities. He contacted Al Majmoua because his son is getting married soon. In fact, he needs to acquire a loan in order to alleviate the burden of the ceremony's costs, and in order to help his son decorate his bedroom in his new apartment. As for the future, Ahmad wishes to expand his work by enlarging the department he works in, or by opening up a new garage.

loans.use: to alleviate the burden of the wedding ceremony's costs, and in order to help his son decorate his bedroom in his new apartment

loans.name: Rafael Arturo

texts.es: El señor Rafael, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe  junto a su esposa e hijas, su mayor sueño es mejorar sus condiciones de Vida, con los creditos anteriores a obtenido mayores ganancias ya que sus clientes han aumentado por lo que n ecesita invertir mucho mas, con este n uevo financiamiento el señor Rafael compra, pacas de Ropa para Damas, Caballeros, Niños, Adolecentes y tambien aprovechara para comprar Paca de Calzado, asi sus ingresos seguiran incrementando y podra invertir en su casa para terminar de Construirla, Agradece el apoyo y Confianza que Fondos Kiva y Afodenic le han brindado
texts.en:
Sr. Rafael lives in the town of Ticuantepe with his wife and daughters. His greatest dream is to improve his living conditions. Previous loans have enabled him to earn greater profits because his customer base has grown. Consequently he needs to invest much more.

With this new funding Sr. Rafael is buying bundles of clothing for women, men, children and adolescents. He will also use it to purchase packages of footwear. As a result, his earnings will continue to grow and he will be able to invest in finishing the construction on his house. He is grateful for the support and confidence that Kiva and Afodenic have shown in him.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothing.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina, 35, is a married woman and the mother of one. She has been doing business as a tailor for about 10 years, to help her husband. She has accepted the fact that, if only her husband works in their family, they will not be able to cover their household expenses in an efficient way. That is why she started tailoring at home, to support her family well. She manages their household with her husband, while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to provide continuous income for their everyday expenses. Now she has applied for a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy more spools of thread and packets of buttons, laces and elastic. In this way, she will be able to meet increasing demand, time after time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She is in her third loan cycle and has a good repayment history. Robina dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread and packets of buttons, laces and elastic for her business as a tailor.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en: Shakeela is 36 years old and a married woman, the mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Shakeela’s husband, who is a driver by profession, and who provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it running normally. For this reason, Shakeela has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000, for her husband’s use. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Shakeela is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and that it will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Saima is a 34-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. She is trying hard to meet their needs, including expenses for food, healthcare, clothing and education. She and her husband have been engaged in agriculture for many years. They grow various vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market. Her son also helps her in growing the various crops, by watering the soil for good quality production. She has gradually improved her business, with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase various types of seeds and packets of insecticides and pesticides, Saima applied a loan of PKR 20,000. This would help her to grow more crops, which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase various types of seeds and packets of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. 

For the past 10 years, she has been running a business of milk sales. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner. With the passage of time, her sales increased and also her income. 

Now she has two buffaloes and one cow. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. 

She has some savings and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase another buffalo. She is in her fifth loan cycle with Kashf Foundation. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: George Ooko

texts.en:
This marks George's sixth borrowing and this time it is to fund his new venture of a retail shop. 

He will use the requested loan to purchase milk, bread, sugar and cooking fat for this new business. His previous loans were repaid successfully. He hopes to have a prosperous business and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase milk, bread, sugar and cooking fat for his new business.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 33-year-old married woman. She has been in the work of tailoring for a period of about three years. She stitches stylish clothes for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. Her husband works in a factory of leather products and earns an income too low to support the needs of the family members alone. 

By now, Rehana has attained a list of regular customers. However, due to lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. 

She is in her second loan cycle and is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a 39 year old retail shop owner in Docks Mombasa, Kenya. She is a single lady who supports four of her siblings. She has been in this business for the last seven years and has done great.

This marks her third borrowing from KADET LTD, to finance her business. She will use the requested loan to purchase trays of eggs, sacks of sugar, rice, cooking fat and bales of wheat flour. She will plow the anticipated profit back into the business. She hopes to have a better life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase trays of eggs, sacks of sugar and rice, cooking fat and bales of wheat flour

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, Rugiatu earns about 2,900,000 Sierra Leonean leone (Le) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. 

Rugiatu has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans. She now requires a new loan in order to purchase mayonnaise, eggs, garri (cassava flakes), vegetable oil and ketchup.

Rugiatu used the income from her last loan to pay school fees for her child and to help provide livelihood for her family.

In the future, Rugiatu plans to build a house, educate her child, and open a restaurant. The loan will help her to achieve some of her future plans. She is hardworking and trustworthy. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy vegetable oil, garri (cassava flakes), eggs, ketchup, spaghetti and mayonnaise, and to pay laborers to transport the goods.

loans.name: Yarjah

texts.en:
This is 48 year old Yarjah.  He is married and has three children, aged seventeen, eleven and eight. He has two additional dependents, who live with him to help his sisters with their education.  In 1991, Yarjah established his patent drug and cosmetics business. He began his business because he wants to be self reliant after dropping out of school. 

His business is located in the outskirts of the city and his main customers are women and lactating mothers. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,253,200 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Yarjah has already received and successfully repaid four loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional drugs and cosmetics. He hopes that this loan can increase the stock and improve his profit. In the future, Yarjah plans to open another outlet in the center of town. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for patent drugs and cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a products for her stationery store

loans.name: James

texts.en:
This is 37 year old James.  He is married and has two children, aged four and nine. In 2003, James established his provision and drinks business. The business started after dropping out of school in order to be self reliant. His business is located in the outskirts of the city and his main customers are adults. 

Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,157,075 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. James has already received and successfully repaid four loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy cement. He hopes that this loan can improve his cement trade business. In the future, James plans to expand to his cement trade and hopes to be able to open an outlet within town. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for provisions and drinks

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has three children and has been doing this work for eight years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops. He stated what is most enjoyable about farming as: “Dairy farming.” His biggest challenge is a “Lack of enough dairy feed.” Animals on the farm have been given the names of “Lelkina.” John was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: “Because they offer a grace period in the first loan.” This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: “That Juhudi Kilimo insures dairy cows.” His greatest monthly expense is for school fees. When asked “How will this loan benefit his family," John replied “In paying school fees.”
As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. John owns the following: “cow, poultry” but does not own “pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile.” Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household “mosquito net, solar power” but does not have “electricity, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD.”
Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a 35 year old retailer of green bananas in Kongowea Mombasa, Kenya. He is a married father of two school going children. He has been in this business for the last seven years and has done great.

This marks his third loan from KADET LTD, to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase green bananas for resale and use the anticipated profit to service his loan. 

His previous loans were paid successfully, he hopes to have a better life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase green bananas for resale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
This is 40 year old Joseph.  He is married and has two children aged three and eight. In 2007, Joseph established his cinema and provisions business. He began his business after losing a brother that was his support so that he could be self reliant. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are adults. 

Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about Le 715,800 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Joseph has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional toiletries and to pay the DSTV (digital satellite) subscription. He hopes that this loan can help grow the business. In the future, Joseph plans to be able to expand his provisions trade. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for drinks

loans.name: Fedha

texts.en:
Fedha comes from the town of Likoni. She is very hardworking, as evidenced day after day by all her efforts. She is a shopkeeper: she has a locale she uses as a general store, which she opens for business very early in the morning. 

Fedha is a married mother; she has seven children whom she has raised at the cost of many sacrifices and struggles. Thanks to all her efforts, her children attend school.

 Fedha was one of the first in her neighborhood in having a general store, and thus has a very strong customer base. In spite of her age, her goal is to make her business keep growing, and this is why she asks for this loan. She wishes to invest the funds in her shop and supply it with sugar, pasta, rice, dairy products, bread products and other supplies. She is thankful for the opportunity granted by the field partner and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy sugar, pasta, rice, dairy products, bread and other supplies.

loans.name: Saidu B.

texts.en:
This is 49-year-old Saidu B. He is married and has three children, 21, 16, and 11 years old. All are school-going children. 

In 2010, Saidu B. established his business, selling things like cigarettes, soap, batteries, paste, milk, sardines, toothbrushes, etc. He began his business because he was not privileged to attend school. He used to farm with his father and when he became mature, he farmed on his own and the proceeds were used to start a small business in the village.  

Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 2,300,000 every month from this business. Inadequate capital is his major challenge.  He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. 

Saidu B. has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now he requires a new loan in order to buy batteries, sardines, Peak milk, and drinks. Saidu B. used some of his prior profit to support his family and pay school fees for his children. Saidu B. also bought a motorbike and a piece of land.

In the future, Saidu B. plans to open another outlet, provide quality education for his children, and build a house. This loan will help him achieve some of his future plans. He is a hard-working businessman. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy batteries, sardines, milk, and drinks for his business.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina, requiere de un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para seguir en su oficio del cultivo de granos básicos; este le ayudara a comprar los insumos agropecuarios tales como: semilla, abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas y preparación de la tierra.
El crédito anterior le permitió obtener mayores ingresos e incremento sus ingresos; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Reina is requesting a new loan because she needs more operating capital so that she can continue growing basic grains. The money will help her to buy farming supplies such as seeds, compost, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides, fungicides, and to pay for preparing her land.

Her previous loan allowed her to generate more earnings and increase her income. Reina’s financial condition and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides, fungicides, and to pay for preparing her land.

loans.name: Sillah

texts.en:
This is thirty-one-year-old Sillah. who is  married and has three children aged four, six and ten. He has two additional dependents, who live with him to assist his niece with their education.  

In 2001, Sillah established his spare parts business. He began his business because he wanted to be self-reliant, to meet his family and personal needs. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are mechanics, vehicle and motorbike owners. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,099,750 every month from this business. 

Sillah would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. He has already received and successfully repaid three loans and now requires a new loan in order to pay for additional engine oil and filters. He hopes that this loan can increase the stock and raise his profit. In the future, Sillah plans to move to a bigger shop as the stock increases, and to open outlets within the town. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy engine oil and filters for a spare-parts business

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is a widow of fifty-two years; she has two school-aged children. She is a farmer and has been in this business for twelve years now. Beth gets a monthly income of five thousand shillings.

This will be Beth's third loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy fertilizer, potatoes and carrot seedlings. In future she wants to be a large-scale farmer in Limuru.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, potatoes  and carrot seedlings

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married. Her husband works as an electrician. Fatuma has a small store and also sells drinks from her home. She is hardworking, responsible, and honest. Her dream was to have a small store and sell drinks. Now she has her own store with a variety of items. She works there everyday from very early in the morning. 

Fatuma is asking for this loan in order to expand a part of her store. In doing this she will be able to show her customers a greater variety of items and continue to grow her business. She is thankful for the opportunity that she has received as it has been a great help.

loans.use: to expand her store in order to show her customers a greater variety of items

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit works at local police station. She is a very proactive and hardworking woman who does her best to sustain her parents' living.

As her salary is barely enough for covering her family's daily costs, Lilit is also engaged in agriculture. She owns a plot of agricultural land where she cultivates potatoes and wheat. Lilit's father sells the gathered harvest in the local market and the family earns income, which is vital for them.

In order to expand her agricultural business, Lilit has applied for this loan. Realizing that land cultivation is very important for her, Lilit would like to enlarge the cultivation of potatoes and wheat and gather more harvest.

With the loan's help, Lilit will purchase potatoes and fertilizer which is very important for successful cultivation of the land. The loan is very important for Lilit to increase her agricultural income and improve her parent's living conditions

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a businesswoman. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have three children; two are grown-ups while one still attends school.

Mariam began in sales thanks to help from her husband, who gave her support. Little by little Mariam began increasing her sales since she herself goes out to offer her products in the neighborhood. She sells mostly clothing for women and children like blouses, shorts, undergarments, T-shirts and sweatshirts. One of her great dreams is to have her own store in the city center. She is asking for a loan to purchase seasonal clothing. This will help her greatly with her sales.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for sale.

loans.name: Muneyi Project Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 52-year-old Elizabeth, from Masvingo, a member of Muneyi Project Group. Elizabeth is single, with two children. She also cares for one other dependent. 

Elizabeth runs a clothing business which sells clothes. The business has been in operation for 15 years. She says the main challenge she is facing is her debtors failing to pay on-time. 

Elizabeth has requested a loan of USD 1,000 to buy suits, hats, and shoes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her an increase in income, hence improving her family's welfare. 

In the future, Elizabeth plans to own a shop in town.

loans.use: to buy suits, hats, and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is married to Musa and together they have been blessed with one child who attends school. Irene lives in a rental house which has electricity and piped water and her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Irene operates a charcoal selling business from home and she has been in this business for the past four years. She is now requesting a loan of KES 15,000 to purchase more charcoal for resale. She aspires to open more businesses in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Fatmata J.

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Fatmata J.  She is single and has two children, ages 13 and 7, both attending school. 

In 2008, Fatmata J. established her business selling provisions (e.g., biscuits, cigarettes, drinks, soap, pure water, paste, Ovaltine, mayonnaise, milk). She began her business because she left school, due to mistreatment by her stepmother.  She got into an early marriage and her husband gave her some money to start a business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 2,000,000 every month from this business. 

Fatmata J. would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy batteries, black mint, sweets, mosquito coils, and biscuits.

Fatmata J. was unable to develop her land, but was able to improve her business. She used part of her profit to pay school fees for her children and she provided livelihood for her family.

In the future, Fatmata J. plans to educate her children, develop her piece of land, and continue to expand her business. Her hope is that this loan helps her to achieve some of her future plans. She is a hard-working and honest businesswoman. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy batteries, black mint, sweets, mosquito coils, biscuits, etc. for her store.

loans.name: Mayra Odilia

texts.es:
Mayra es una joven de 23 años de edad soltera, luchadora, emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superarse y de salir adelante. Ella es madre de una hija la cual es su razón de ser y por la cual ella emprende y logra cada una de sus metas propuestas hasta hoy en día. Ella tiene un grado de educación escolar de primaria completado y no pudo continuar por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres. Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde muy pequeña ya que sus padres por tradición son agricultores y se han dedicado a la siembra de maíz, frijol, papa, repollo entre otros desde hace mucho tiempo. Son sus padres su único apoyo en la agricultura ya que ella es madre soltera y sus cultivos están a 10 minutos de camino desde su casa de habitación.

Actualmente ella necesita ayuda para la compra de 2 cajas de semilla de papa de calidad, abono y fertilizantes para asegurar y mejorar su cosecha.

Sus sueños a futuro son los de poder ahorrar un capital con el cual pueda asegurar los estudios de su hija, los gastos y demás que a la larga puedan salir para evitar que su hija pase por la misma situación que ella en su niñez y en su juventud paso.
texts.en:
Mayra is a single 23 year old woman. She is feisty, resourceful and eager to excel and succeed. She is mother to a daughter who is her reason for being and for whom she has undertaken and achieved each one of her proposed goals until today. Mayra  completed primary school however she was unable to continue her education due to her parents’ lack of financial resources. 

Since she was very young Mayra has made a living as a farmer because her parents have traditionally been farmers. They cultivate corn, beans, potatoes and cabbages, among other crops. Her parents are the only ones who help her with farming since she is a single mother and her fields are a ten minute walk from her house.

Currently she needs help to purchase two packages of high quality potato seed, as well as compost and fertilizer, in order to ensure and improve her harvest. 

Her future dreams are to be able to save some capital with which she will be able to secure her daughter’s education and pay her expenses and other costs that can arise over time. This will prevent her daughter having to face the same situation she did during her own childhood and youth.

loans.use: to purchase potato seed, compost and fertilizer for farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, pesticides and other supplies.

loans.name: Olga Yanira

texts.es:
Olga, se le presenta la necesidad de adquirir un nuevo préstamo porque requiere más capital de trabajo; este le permitirá comprar shampoo, tintes para el cabello, cremas, esmaltes, labial, rubor, maquillaje, entre otros cosméticos.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar la clientela y sus ingresos asimismo, estos los invierte en la educación de sus hijos; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
Olga needs a new loan because she requires greater working capital. This will allow her to buy shampoo, hair dye, creams, nail polish, lipstick, blush, foundation and other cosmetics. 

Her previous loan helped her to expand her clientele and earnings at the same time. She invests her earnings in the education of her children. Her economic conditions and family life have improved.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, hair dye, creams, nail polish, lipstick, blush, foundation and other cosmetics.

loans.name: Mariama B.

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Mariama. She is married to a petty trader, and she has two children, ages 20 and 23 years. She has three additional dependents living with her, because she takes care of them while they attend school in the city. 

In 2001, Mariama established her 'gara' clothing (locally dyed clothing) business. She began her business because she wanted to be self-employed in order to have a dependable means of earning income and to help her husband provide livelihood for their children. She made good profits for the upkeep of her family, and that is why she loves this type of business. 

Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 900,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Mariama requires a loan in order to buy one bale of brilliant materials to produce different types of gara cloth, including clothing, bedding, and curtains. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL.

Mariama used the proceeds from her last loan to pay school fees for her children and provide livelihood for her family. Mariama has yet to open the big shop she is planning to open.
