In the future, Mariama plans to open a big shop and continue to sponsor her children as they go through their education smoothly. Competition is high, but she offers the best and latest fashions, giving her an edge over her competitors. She supplies customers in Freetown and Makeni Town, offering the latest patterns and designs to suit her customers' needs. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy one bale of brilliant materials to produce different types of 'gara' cloth.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is from Likoni. She is a widow and is the owner of a store that sells various types of clothing in Likoni, where she has worked with her mother for more than sixteen years.

She is a very hard-working person who, thanks to her efforts, is getting ahead and helping her family day by day. She tells us that things are very difficult, but in spite of that she makes an effort to move forward.

She is asking for this loan in order to purchase clothing of all types to supply her business and in this way to be able to continue working and having sales that will give her the income to maintain her home.

loans.use: to purchase clothing of all types to supply her business

loans.name: Mwatime

texts.en: Thanks to the work that she is doing,  Mwatime is educating her children and buying everything she needs in her household. She is a very hardworking person who has always fought for her family to give them everything they need. She is asking for the loan to buy ingredients to keep producing her baked goods, such as flour, eggs, salt, yeast, and more. With these, she can keep working.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to keep producing her baked goods, such as flour, eggs, salt, yeast, and more.

loans.name: Bai

texts.en:
This is Bai. He is 37, married, and has one child, aged 3 years. He has two additional dependents who live with him and help with his business while they attend school. 

In 2000, Bai established his business. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 2,4000,000 every month. One major challenge he faces is the unstable foreign exchange rate.

Bai would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. He requires a loan in order to purchase some pieces of UPS, some hard disk drives, flash drives and A4 paper to sell. This will increase his working capital and he is looking forward to subsequent loans.

Bai used profit from his last loan to support his family by providing livelihood for them. He was unable to open the new computer shop he plans to open, however, he says he is working very hard to achieve this.

Bai describes himself as hard-working and committed to his business. In the future, Bai plans to open a computer school. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase some pieces of UPS, some hard disk drives, flash drives, and A4 paper to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca's Group

texts.en:
Rebecca, 35, is married with two adorable children who are of school-going age. She sells foodstuffs like cooking oil, maize (corn) and ‘Gari’ (food product from cassava). She began this business by learning it from her mother and now she has six years of experience. She also has the support of her husband, who is a driver. She joined this group and she has decided to request a loan of GHC 700 to be used for the purchase of maize, gari and cooking oil. In this way, she can increase her working capital. 

The other members are Rosemond, Janet, Henrieta, Elizabeth, Juliana and Mabel who make earn living through sales. They are in second-hand clothing, cosmetics, clothing materials, provisions, fish and soft drinks selling.

In the future Rebecca hopes to have enough capital to be able to supply to her numerous customers. That is her ambition.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like cooking oil, maize (corn) and ‘Gari’ (food product from cassava)

loans.name: Minkailu

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Minkailu.  He is married and has four children, ages 11, 16, 18 and 20 years. All of them attend school. In 2001, Minkailu established his slippers business, selling comfort shoes, madam slippers, toilet slippers, foam sandals, foam slippers, etc. He began his business after he dropped out of school. Minkailu also worked as a laborer in order to earn some money to start the business so that he can get back to school.  But the business became so interesting that he decided to continue with it rather than going back to school. 

Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, Minkailu earns about SLL 3,600,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000.  Minkailu has already received and successfully repaid four loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase comfort slippers, madam slippers, foam slippers, sponge sandals, sponge slippers, and toilet slippers for resale.

Mankailu uses his profit to support his family. He paid school fees and bought learning materials for his children. He has not been able to buy a car, but has now opened a new business for his wife.

In the future, Minkailu plans to build a house, provide a quality education for his children, and buy a car. This loan will help to improve his business. Minkailu is hardworking and trustworthy. He hopes to maintain a good credit history. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy plastic shoes and slippers for resale

loans.name: Alija

texts.en:
Alija is living in the western part of Kosovo in a Roma community. He is a married father of eight children. Alija has been a self-employed musician for many years who performs at weddings and other celebrations in his area. He usually works exclusively in the summer as weather conditions prevent weddings, celebrations, and other events from being held during the winter. This job is the main source of income for his family. 

Currently he and his family live in a small, old house. Alija needs a loan to add one annex room in his small house. The loan will help his family to have some more space for his children and he hopes in the future to have a bigger house. He is very grateful for this opportunity to improve his living conditions and he appreciates all lenders!

loans.use: To add an annex room

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is from Likoni and is single. She describes herself as a person who wants to work in order to get ahead and to be able to support her four children.

She is the owner of a food store that sells cooked beans, rice and chapati (flat bread). It is located in a very good spot, and she has customers that always buy food from her. In this way, she is able to move ahead.

Her dream is to build areas for lodging, since many traveling vendors come to her business; she sees a lot of potential in this goal.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy wheat flour, maize flour, rice and cooking fat so that she can stock her food store. In this way, she will continue providing good service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy various kinds of food: wheat flour, maize flour, rice and cooking fat to stock her store.

loans.name: Nunufar

texts.en:
Nunufar has been involved in agriculture for many years. She keeps livestock (calf, cow and chickens) and grows peach, apricot, nut and apple trees. As a mother of two children, Nunufar works hard to gather a good harvest. Nunufar's husband sells the agricultural products in the local markets and gathers income which is vital for covering family's basic costs. 

In order to expand their farming business, Nunufar would like to expand her livestock. Having no financial means for that, Nunufar has applied to SEF International for a loan. The loan will be used to purchase calves and oxen, as well as fertilizer for successful cultivation of the land. This loan is very important for Nunufar and her husband to enlarge their farm and ensure a better life for their children.

loans.use: to pay for calves and oxen and to buy fertilizer for the cultivation of the land.

location.town: Agarakadzor village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Matilda's Group

texts.en:
This is the Matilda’s group, made up of three hardworking and responsible women who, through their businesses, are improving themselves every day. 

Matilda, 46, is married and has two children who are at school. Taking over her mother's trade, since she had been making a living in this activity, Alexandra decided to sell ‘kenkey’ (cooked corn paste) and fried fish at a small market at Teshie. She feels happy because ID-Ghana has come with this loan facility which has helped her household. 

Her keenest desire is to own a grocery store as in this way she will have better profits. The loan sought will be allocated to buying more maize and fish to meet customers' demand.

Matilda’s group needs an amount of GHC 1,650 to help them increase their stock.

loans.use: To buy more maize and fish to meet customers' demand.

loans.name: Dalila De Fátima

texts.es:
Dalila de Fátima es una joven de 31 años, casada, madre de un pequeño niño, estudió la carrera de Ingeniería civil porque desde niña sonó con diseñar y construir casas.

Actualmente se desempeña como tal en una Institución donde es la encargada de los proyectos donde se construyen sobre todo obras sociales para las personas de escasos recursos del municipio de El Sauce prácticamente de las comarcas aledañas donde predomina la pobreza.

Tiene muchos años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde le han otorgado varios créditos con los que ha mejorado su nivel de vida porque hoy su casa tiene mejores condiciones lo que se siente muy agradecida por este apoyo que le han brindado los inversionistas de Kiva.

Hace pocos meses tuvo su primer hijo y con el fin de darle mejores condiciones se presentó a Ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento con el que piensa comprar pintura y pago de mano de obra.

Confía en Dios que su solicitud sea aprobada para llevar a cabo su inversión.
texts.en:
Dalila de Fátima, 31, is a young woman, married and has a small son. She studied Civil Engineering; she always dreamed of designing and building houses. She currently works as an engineer for an institution. She is in charge of different projects, mainly focused on people with few economic resources in the poor communities surrounding El Sauce.

Dalila has been working with CEPRODEL for many years and has been granted numerous loans that have improved her quality of life. She has better living conditions now and she feels grateful for the support that Kiva lenders have given her.

Some months ago, she had her first child. With the intention to offer him better living conditions, she came to CEPRODEL to request a loan to buy paint and pay for labor. She trusts that God will help her to receive this loan in order to make this investment.

loans.use: to buy paints and pay for labor.

loans.name: Nike Air Group

texts.en:
ZAINABU, who is in her late 30s, is married with two children who go to school.  She has been a food vendor for eight years now.  She works from 6.00 am to 4.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her food stock and continued restocking the missing items.  She used the profit to pay for school fees and covered household expenses.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She will use this loan to restock the missing items in the food store. She dream of owing a hotel.

Zainabu will share this loan with her loan group "Nike Air" with fourteen members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock  the missing items in her food store.

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en:
This is Joyce’s group, made up of two hardworking, responsible women; and they are part of a main group called Peace. 

Joyce, 38, is married to a photographer and they have three children who are at the ages of 16, 12, and 5, and are all schooling.  Joyce decided to go into selling of clothing materials because people of Teshie prefer to sew their own dresses rather than buying second-hand clothing which makes her trade very profitable. 

She desires to own a very big clothing materials store as this will earn her more profits. The loan sought will be used to buy clothing materials, and in this way, offer her customers better service. She needs GHC 1,300 to be able to expand her business.

The two women need GHS 2,500 to be able buy more goods and serve customers better.

loans.use: To buy clothing materials

loans.name: Moises

texts.en:
Moises is an artisan who specializes in hand-crafted furniture. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of leather and wood in order to get a lower price and be able to craft more pieces.

Moises has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is his story:

At the age of 15, Moises moved to Lima to study leather and woodcraft with his uncle. "After a six-year apprenticeship, I started a workshop with my brother who, sadly, passed away in 1980. I proudly honor his memory with my work. Now it's my turn to train others in the family – my nephews and other relatives. Some of my sisters work with me as well. My art is a medium to express my country's culture and transmit the essence of Peru," he says.

"I would like to thank you all for this microcredit on behalf of my family and the artisans working with me. It is a great feeling knowing there are people out there who support us and our work -- you motivate us to keep on doing what we do. May God bless you!"

Use the link below to view Moises's leather and wood furniture on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/5041

loans.use: to purchase leather and wood in bulk at a better price

loans.name: Nono

texts.en:
Nono specializes in traditional Indonesian rod puppets. He would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials such as wood and fabric.

Nono has been selling through NOVICA since 2008. This is his story:

Rod puppets, or wayang golek, are one of Indonesia's most original art forms, especially popular in West Java. Making wayang golek is a skill handed down from one generation to the next. Master puppeteer Nono was taught by an uncle, while another uncle, a renowned puppet master, taught him how to perform. Nono must know the stories, histories, personalities and conventions of gods and heroes. The puppeteer also sings and directs the gamelan musicians as he performs.

"I want to convey my gratitude to all of you who are supporting me with this microcredit loan, as it will make it possible for me to acquire the materials to build up my stock. I hope you like my work and consider my rod puppets to decorate your home. Thanks!"

Use the link below to view Nono's rod puppets on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/6905

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as wood and fabric for his puppets

loans.name: Eris Rodolfo

texts.es:
Eris, requiere de un nuevo préstamo por la buena atención que la Institución y para el fortalecimiento del negocio; este le permitirá comprar artículos de librería tales como: cuadernos, libros, lapiceros, lápices, asimismo granos básicos, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sal, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar las ganancias y su clientela satisfechos por la mercadería que brinda; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Eris is requesting a new loan to strengthen his business. He thinks the institution has a good customer service. With the loan, he will buy stationery items such as notebooks, books, pens and pencils. He will also buy basic grains, rice, beans, sugar and salt, among other supplies.

The previous loan helped him to increase his profits and his customers are satisfied with the assortment he has. His family’s financial and living conditions have improved.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, books, pens, pencils and supplies such as rice, beans, sugar and salt.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Benkadi sont toutes mariées et vivent dans des familles monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 24 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent ensemble dans le quartier de Missira à Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leur activité, des liens de parenté et de mariage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de pagnes (wax, real, hollandais), des chaussures, et des produits cosmétiques. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Catherine (la 1ere femme debout de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est connue dans le quartier de Missira par sa qualité de vendeuse de pagnes (real wax, hollandais etc.) Elle compte utiliser son prêt dans l’achat de plusieurs pièces de pagnes  auprès des grossistes dans le but de les revendre au comptant sur place. Madame Catherine  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les besoins du foyer et frais de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The four women of the Benkadi Group are all married and live in monogamous families. They have an average age of 24 years and an average of two children. They live together in the Missira district in Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They know one another through ties of commerce, kinship and marriage. The members of the group are merchants of pagnes (traditional West African dyed cloth), shoes, and cosmetics. In order to increase their business capital, the members have collaborated with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan.

Catherine (shown in the photo standing on the far right) is known in the Missira district for the quality of pagnes she sells. She plans to use the loan to purchase several pagnes from wholesalers with the goal of reselling them for cash on the spot. With this loan, Catherine hopes to earn an average monthly income of 20,000 FCFA. She plans to use her earnings to reinvest in her business, to pay for household necessities, and to pay for the health care costs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase pagnes (traditional West African dyed cloth)

loans.name: Fermin

texts.en:
Fermin specializes in weaving rugs. He would like to make a bulk purchase of wool and dyes to increase production.

Fermin has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"My two brothers and I learned to weave on a traditional loom. I was ten when I began to weave with my father and, when I was 14, I became independent. We had little looms made to our size where we wove narrow textiles. Today, I weave rugs of wool and cotton. I have my own workshop at home and we all weave on handlooms powered by foot pedals. I enjoy designing and weaving new rug styles, a tradition in my town handed down for generations."

"Thank you for supporting my work through this microcredit. This is such a great opportunity, as it is often difficult to have enough funds to buy the quality materials I need in larger quantities and at a better price. May God bless you all."

Use the link below to view Fermin's hand-loomed rugs on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7472

loans.use: to make a bulk purchase of wool and dyes

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a Ghanaian artist who specializes in carving masks and sculptures. He would like to make a bulk purchase of wood and metal plates to increase production.

Evans has been selling through NOVICA since 2002. This is his story:

"As of now, carving has made me the breadwinner of my family - they all look to and count on me for their day-to-day survival. My products have been taken to craft markets in France and Germany by a good friend, and these markets have shown wonderful and incredible interest in them. This has earned me a place to attend various arts and craft fairs both locally and internationally. I have showcased several of my products at these fairs, gaining admiration from my customers and art critics."

"I appreciate your kindness by being part of this microcredit. Your gesture will help me to prepare my stock of products with all the materials I can now afford. I thank you so much for this help."

Use the link below to view Evans's hand-carved wood sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/3362

loans.use: to purchase wood and metal plates for his masks and sculptures

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor specializes in traditional West African hand-carved masks. He would like to make a bulk purchase of metal plates, paints, and polish.

Victor has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

"I learned the art of carving from my uncle. I had to stay with my him after my parents separated and he put me through school. It was fascinating to see how a log of wood could be used to create beautiful objects. This, I believe, initiated the desire in me to know and learn more about this art. I have trained several people and continue to train others. I also train students in their second and third year of senior school who visit the workshop."

"I would like to increase my stock of finished masks, so I thank you for supporting my work through this microcredit."

Use the link below to view Victor's hand-carved masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8743

loans.use: to purchase metal plates, paints, and polish for his masks

loans.name: Epifanio

texts.es: Epifanio de 43 años, convive con Elida con quien tiene 4 hijos. Esta familia vive en una casa propia construida por él mismo, y se ubica en un anexo agrícola.Epifanio es un hombre trabajador. Se dedica a la agricultura, y como buen hombre del campo sale todas las mañanas de su hogar con sus herramientas, aprovechando los primeros rayos de sol, para cultivar sus productos. Produce papa de distintas variedades , las cuales son muy solicitadas en el mercado. Estos detalles lo saben porque lleva 24 años en está actividad. Desde hace un mes ya empezó con las siembras, y como cuenta con parcelas en distintas y lejanas zonas, recién este mes culminará con lo que quedó pendiente. Ya cuenta con semillas de papas, puesto que en cada cosecha selecciona un porcentaje para emplearlas más adelante. Epifanio solicita de su apoyo, para adquirir bolsas de fertilizantes orgánicos y concluir con sus siembras del año. Este es el tercer crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para continuar con su actividad laboral.Epifanio, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Epifanio, 43, lives with Elida with whom he has four children. This family lives in a house they own that he, himself, built. It is located in an agricultural annex. Epifanio is a hardworking man. He is a farmer and like a good man of the fields he leaves every morning from his home, taking advantage of the sun’s first rays and carrying his tools, to cultivate his crops. He produces different varieties of potatoes, which are in high demand in the market. He understands these details because he has been a farmer for 24 years.

Epifanio began planting a month ago and since he has plots in different and distant areas he just recently finished with what was pending. He already has seed potatoes, since he selects a percentage from each harvest to use later. He is requesting your support to acquire sacks of organic fertilizer and finish with this year’s sowing. This is his third loan from KIVA and he is grateful for the financial support he receives so that he can continue with his work. Epifanio will invest the S/. 3000 in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nourish his fields.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Balvina

texts.en:
Balvina is an artisan who specializes in arpillera, or Peruvian appliqué. She would like to invest in building up her stock of the fabric pieces she uses in her art.

Balvina has been selling through NOVICA since 2008. This is her story:

Balvina says, "This is a medium of expression for me to show the world how beautiful nature is, especially in the Peruvian Andes. I know it so well–-my roots are there, and my work depicts our traditions, customs and landscapes."

"I would like to send a big kiss to all of you for supporting me through this microcredit. I thank you from the bottom of my heart. All of this helps me in my work, and therefore in providing for my family."

Use the link below to view Balvina's arpillera appliqué on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/6649

loans.use: to build up her stock of fabric pieces for her patchwork

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of two ladies, one selling slippers and the other provisions. They form part of the mother group called "With God."

Rose is a 41-year-old woman living with her 8-year-old child. She sells slippers for a living and hawks her products. She has requested a loan of GHS 700 to purchase two bags of slippers.

Beatrice has been selling provision for 24 years.  Together, they need GHS 1,450 to be able to serve their customers better.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of slippers to sell to customers.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Djekafo sont mariées majoritairement  dans des familles  monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent ensemble dans le quartier de Missira à Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leur activité, des liens de parenté et de mariage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de produits cosmétiques, du bois de chauffe et des chaussures. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
 Madame Bintou (1ere femme debout de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est connue dans le quartier de Missira par sa qualité de vente des produits cosmétiques et divers. Elle compte utiliser son prêt dans l’achat de plusieurs paquets de mèches, des pommades et des ongles artificiels chez son fournisseur à Bamako. La revente se fait au comptant en détail et à crédit à une clientèle diverse et variée. Madame Bintou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.000FCFA qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité pour augmenter son pouvoir d’achat.
texts.en:
The four women of the Djekafo Group are all married and live mainly in monogamous families. They have an average age of 30 years and and average of two children. They live together in the Missira district of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They know one another through ties of commerce, kinship and marriage. The members of the group are merchants of cosmetics, firewood and shoes. In order to increase their business capital, the members have collaborated with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan.

Bintou (shown in the photo standing on the far right) is known in the Missira district for the quality of the cosmetics and other products she sells. She plans to use the loan to buy several packs of hair extensions, pomades, and artificial nails from her supplier in Bamako. She retails her merchandise for cash and credit to a diverse and varied clientele. With the help of this loan, Bintou hopes to earn an average monthly income of 22,000 FCFA which she plans to reinvest into her business so as to increase her purchasing power.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy hair and beauty products for her salon.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary, 45, is a member of a group called Otinkorang and sells fried yam, fried chicken and fish. She is single and has one child who is 9 years old. She has a lot of experience as she has been doing this job for 18 years. These years have brought her a lot of customers, who she really cares about. Rosemary is now on her fifth loan cycle and is requesting 1,300 Ghanaian cedis (GHS), which she will use to buy yams, cooking oil, fish and chicken in order to serve her customers well.

loans.use: to buy yams, cooking oil, fish and chicken

loans.name: Siguidia Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Siguidia est constitué de 6 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles  à Massablacoura, un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Afin de  renforcer leurs capacités financières pour de mieux faire leurs commerces, elles ont adhéré s à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur sixième  prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de céréales,  de condiments, etc.
AMINATA, première de la droite vers la gauche, fait l’achat vente de céréales.  Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  700 kilos de fonio et de maïs auprès des grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché, dans les foires des villages environnants  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Siguidia Group is made up of six married women who have an average age of 36 years and and average of four children. They all live in traditional families in Massablacoura, a district of the city of Bougouni.

They know one another through ties of vicinity, friendship and commerce. In order to improve their financial positions, and with the goal of improving their business, the group is collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are currently on their sixth loan. This group of women are merchants of grain, sauces, etc.

Aminata, shown in the photo on the far right, is a grain merchant. With this loan, she intends to purchase 700 kilograms of fonio (a species of millet) and corn from wholesalers. Aminata sells her merchandise for cash and credit at the local market, in surrounding villages, and from her home to a clientele composed of men and women. She hopes to earn an average monthly income of 50,000 FCFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and repay her loan.

loans.use: to purchase grain for resale.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 54 years old and married with four children.

Letecia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like bread, biscuits, soft drinks, noodles, and other groceries.

Letecia has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 32 years and also earns an income from a local eatery.

Letecia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bread, biscuits, soft drinks, noodles, and other groceries.

loans.name: Lavella

texts.en: Lavella, a 27-year-old married mother of three children, one of whom is in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past seven years she has operated a business selling sea-shells in the Philippines. Lavella has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sea-shells for resale. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sea-shells for resale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her food business.

Maria successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is relisting Maria's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Elsa requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

She has been in this business for 14 years.

In the future, Elsa would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Palmira

texts.pt:
Palmira é casada e mãe de 2 filhos que frequentam o quarto e quinto ano do ensino primário. Ela vive na casa própria com o esposo e filhos, os quais sustenta com ajuda do esposo.
A Palmira é negociante há mais de 5 anos e trabalha mais de 10 horas por dia. Ela compra os seus produtos a distribuidores que trazem os produtos de Maputo para Boane e depois vende-os no mercado. Com o recente empréstimo vai comprar sabão, caldos e óleo para revender.
No futuro pretende construir uma casa melhor, visto que agora tem apenas um quarto. Palmira vai continuar a fazer poupanças no banco, liquidar o empréstimo e solicitar mais, para que possa alcançar os seus objectivos.
texts.en:
Palmira is married and the mother of two children who are in the fourth and fifth grades. She and her husband live in their own home with their children, for whom they share financial responsibility.
Palmira has had a business for more than five years and works more than ten hours a day. She buys her products from distributors who bring them from Maputo to Boane and then sells them in the market. She will use this loan to buy soap, broth, and oil to resell.
In the future she intends to buy a better house, as the one she has has only one room. Palmira will continue to save her money, pay off her loans, and request more so that she can reach her goals.

loans.use: to buy soap, broth, and oil to sell in the market.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia, 53 years old and single, has been raising pigs in the Philippines for 15 years now. Having borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business, she has requested a PHP 29500 loan to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Lucia would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elecia

texts.en:
Elecia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food production business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food production business. Elecia has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from fishing.

Elecia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rabeca

texts.pt:
Rabeca é negociante há mais de 10 anos e trabalha mais de 10 horas por dia. É solteira, vive na casa própria e é mãe de 5 filhos que frequentam o nível primário e secundário, dos quais apenas 1 ainda vive com ela.
Com o recente empréstimo vai comprar tomate, alho, feijão, óleo para revender. No futuro pretende construir uma mercearia numa zona comercial, mas antes vai economizar mais o dinheiro das receitas de venda e fará mais empréstimos na Hluvuku-Adsema.
texts.en:
Rabeca has had a business for more than ten years and works more than ten hours a day. She is single and lives in her own home. She has her five children in elementary and secondary school; only one of them still lives with her.
She will use this loan to buy tomatoes, garlic, beans, and oil to resell. In the future she plans to build a shop in a commercial area, but first she will be frugal with her earnings and request more loans from Hluvuku-Adsema.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, garlic, beans, and oil to sell.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla, a 66-year-old married mother of three, works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for two years and also earns an income from a cafeteria.

Priscilla, who has borrowed and repaid nine previous loans from NWTF, has requested a new one for PHP 12000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 61 years old and married, with four children, one of whom is in school. Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more groceries to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items, such as bread, soft drinks, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elmurod

texts.ru: Элмуроду 58 лет. Он женат, имеет двоих детей и проживет со своей семьей в городе Худжанде на севере Таджикистана. Его жена работает в школе преподавательницей, а Элмурод и его сын занимаются услугой маршрутного такси. Сейчас Элмурод хочет начать бизнес в области животноводства. Он считает, что это очень прибыльный бизнес, так как быстро приносит свои плоды, и к тому же расходы на содержание скота относительно невелики, а спрос на мясо и мясные продукты стабильно высокий и падать не будет, поскольку продукты питания всегда востребованы на рынке. Элмурод планирует заняться купле-продажей крупнорогатого скота. У него во дворе дома имеется коровник. Он запрашивает кредит для закупа 3-х голов крупнорогатого скота с целью откорма и продажи. С помощью этого кредита он будет иметь прибыльный бизнес и финансовое положение его семьи улучшится.
texts.en:
Elmurod is 58 years old. He is married, has two children, and resides with his family in the city of Khujand in northern Tajikistan. His wife works as a schoolteacher, and Elmurod and his son offer a route taxi service. 

Now, Elmurod wants to start a business in the field of animal husbandry. He believes that this is a lucrative business that quickly bears fruit. Further, he believes the costs of maintaining livestock are relatively small while the demand for meat and meat products is consistently high and will not fall because of the food demand in the market. 

Elmurod plans to buy and sell cattle. He has a barn near his home. He is asking for a loan for the purchase of three heads of cattle for fattening and resale. With the help of this loan, he will have a profitable business and the financial position of his family will improve.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Lisefa

texts.pt:
Lisefa é solteira, não tem filhos e vive na casa do irmão com os seus dois sobrinhos. Ela trabalha na secretaria de uma escola primária e tem 8 horas de trabalho diárias. Lisefa terminou o curso médio de administração pública no ano passado, estando este ano a fazer estágio.
Para complementar o seu rendimento, ela tem também um salão de cabeleireiro onde oferece um posto de trabalho. Com este empréstimo vai comprar secadores, espelhos, escovas e rolos para os serviços do seu salão.
No futuro pretende construir casa própria. Para alcançar os seus sonhos vai continuar a fazer mais pedidos de empréstimos na Hluvuku-Adsema.
texts.en: Lisefa is single and has no children. She lives with her brother and her two nephews. She works in the office of an elementary school eight hours every day. She finished her studies in public administration last year and will do her internship this year. To supplement her income, she also runs a hair salon. She will use this loan to buy hairdryers, mirrors, brooms, and rollers so she can offer her services. In the future she hopes to build her own home. She will reach this goal by requesting more loans from Hluvuku-Adsema.

loans.use: to buy hairdryers, mirrors, brooms, and rollers for her hair salon.

loans.name: Jogelyn

texts.en:
Jogelyn is 37 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jogelyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Jogelyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Merodyn

texts.en:
Merodyn is 33 years old, married, and has two children who are both in school.

Merodyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

Merodyn has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Donyor

texts.ru: Донёр после успешного окончания средней школы, поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет Политики и Бизнеса. Он был одним из лучших учеников школы. Он участвовал на олимпиаде по информатике, а также активно участвовал в общественной жизни школы. Он данное время является студентом 2 курса по специальности Финансы и кредит. Он неоднократно участвовал в олимпиаде среди студентов по предметам финансы, микроэкономика, родной язык и т.п. Он является гордостью своих родителей. Он холост и живет с родителями и братьями и сестрами. Он очень любит свою семью. Будущим мечтает работать в банке. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
After successfully graduating from high school, Donyor entered the Tajik State University of Politics and Business. He was one of the best students in his school. He participated in the Olympiad in informatics, and has actively participated in the school community. He is currently a 2nd year student in Finance and Credit. He has repeatedly taken part in the competition among students in the subjects of finance, microeconomics, native language, and the like. 

He is the pride of his parents. He is single and lives with his parents, brothers and sisters. He very much loves his family. In the future, he dreams of working in a bank. 

He is asking for a loan to pay his school tuition.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Soyoltsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Soyoltsetseg, 45 years old, lives with her two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on plot of land. 

For three years, she has been selling kitchen furniture to local people and it is her only income for her family's support. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and it needs some serious repair. Also, Soyoltsetseg wants to plant flowers on her land and for this purpose, she wants to build a greenhouse. 

She is requesting a loan of MNT 7,000,000 to purchase building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, foams, and planks. Using those materials, she together with her two children, can repair and insulate their old house and build a greenhouse on their land. 

The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, thus releasing fewer pollutants into the atmosphere. Additionally, the greenhouse will provide the necessary conditions for flowers to undergo photosynthesis, which enables carbon dioxide to turn into oxygen. All of this loan will be used for environmental protection purposes. The borrower is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials to renovate her home and to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en: Karen is a 55-year-old mother who was gifted with only one child. Since farming is the main source of their living, she supported her husband in managing their rice-farming business to ensure a high production. They aimed to increase their production and income to satisfy their necessities and save some for future emergencies. Due to insufficient capital, Karen is asking for an additional of PHP 50,000 to buy the fertilizers and insecticides needed to sustain their rice production. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted in order to improve their rice farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed to sustain their rice production

loans.name: Abdullojon

texts.ru:
Абдуллоджону 42 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет одного ребенка, которому 20 лет. Он более 6 лет занимается предоставлением услуги строителя. Вначале он был учеником и сейчас самостоятельно работает как опытный строитель. Он изучил все тонкости своего дела и успешно ведет своё дело. Он уже многие годы хочет отремонтировать свой дом, но 
не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки шифера и древесины для ремонта дома. Он ждет вашу доброту и обещает погасить займ во время.
texts.en:
Abdullojon is 42 years old. He is married and has one child who is 20 years old. For more than six years, he has been providing services as a builder. At first, he was a student but now he works independently as an experienced construction worker. He learned the ins and outs of the trade and successfully conducts his business. 

He has for many years wanted to renovate his home but does not have the money. He is asking for a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy slate and wood for his home repairs. He promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy slate and wood to repair his house

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 57 years old and married, with four children, one of whom is in school.

Monica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks to sell, like soap, noodles, and canned goods.

Monica has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns income from buy-and-sell charcoal and from farming rice.

Monica aspires to save enough money for business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, like soap, noodles, and canned goods.

loans.name: Yondonsharav

texts.en: Mr. Yondonsharav is 44 years old and lives with his wife and son in a house the family owns in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has worked as a tractor driver at a heat and power station for the last six years. His wife and son are employed and earn monthly salaries. The house they live in has poorly-constructed walls and windows through which winds and storms seep and chill the family to down to their bones. He is requesting a loan for 7,000,000 MNT to buy a low-pressure heater and building materials such as planks, bricks and cement which he will use to build an extension to his house that will alleviate heat loss and preserve energy. The low-pressure heater will also reduce their consumption of coal and result in less pollutants released into atmosphere. The borrower is very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy a heater and building materials.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is 57 years old, married, and has six children.

Lily is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Lily requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lily has been farming vegetables for 30 years now and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lily would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Человек, который является добросовестным и трудолюбивым, мечтает улучшить условию проживания. Ее зовут Шарофат. Ей 25 лет, она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Детям 4, 2 и 1 года. Она живет в селе и поэтому имеет хорошие условия для скотоводства. Более 10 лет она занимается скотоводством. Она в основном откармливает мелко-рогатого скота. Она продает скот, за которым она присматривалась в течение нескольких месяцев. Теперь она хочет развевать свой бизнес дальше, то есть купить 2 крупно - рогатого скота. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  6000 сомони для покупки 2 голов крупно - рогатого скота, чтобы развевать бизнес. С полученного  дохода она собирается обеспечить своих детей хорошим условием проживания. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Sharofat is a person who is conscientious and hardworking, and she dreams of better living conditions. She is 25 years old. She is married and has three children, aged four, two, and one. She lives in a village and therefore has good conditions for raising livestock. She has been working with livestock for more than ten years. She mainly fattens small-horned livestock. She sells cattle which she has cared for over the course of a few months. 

Now, she wants to expand her business further by buying two long-horn cows. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 somoni to buy two cows in order to develop her business. 

With the profits earned, she is going to provide her children with good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two cows for her business

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 37 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Marivic is borrowing a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy a variety of new seeds, pay for the salary of laborers, and buy fertilizers.

Marivic has been farming rice for 11 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of new seeds, pay for the salary of laborers, and buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Teresita is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of items to sell like chips, soft drinks, canned goods, etc., for her general store business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of items to sell like chips, soft drinks, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Ludy

texts.es: Ludy, de 30 años de edad vive junto a su esposo Valerio y su pequeño hijo a los que cuida en la casa que le fue heredada por sus padres.Desde niña dedicó sus esfuerzos a la agricultura y  a la venta de ganado, cultiva principalmente papa, maíz y alfalfa . Comenta que es rentable la crianza de animales porque siembra alfalfa y esta lo utiliza como su alimentación , además vende alfalfa en grandes cantidades y los distribuye a los comerciantes. Cada 6 meses aproximadamente cosecha sus alimentos y los comercializa a sus clientes, además de la venta de su ganado, para el futuro quiere tener un establo grande y más extensiones de terreno para incrementar sus ganancias.Es la tercera oportunidad de crédito con KIVA, siempre ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos, pues le enseñaron a ser responsable y muy solidaria en su asociación. Ludy, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos de alfalfa.
texts.en:
Ludy is thirty years old and lives with her husband Valerio and their young son. She takes care of them in the home she inherited from her parents. Ever since she was a child, she dedicated her effort to farming and selling cattle. She mainly grows potatoes, corn, and alfalfa. She says raising animals is profitable because she grows alfalfa and uses it to feed them. She also sells large amounts of alfalfa and distributes it among vendors. Besides selling her cattle, approximately every six months she harvests her products and sells them to her customers. In the future she would like to have a large stable and more land in order to increase her profits. 

This is her third loan opportunity through Kiva. She has always made her payments on time, because she was taught to be responsible and very supportive of her association. Ludy will invest the 1,000 soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nourish her alfalfa crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилорому 51 года. Она замужем и имеет одного ребенка, которому 24 года. Так как она живет в селе, основным источником ее семейного дохода является земледелие и скотоводство. Она более 17 лет занимается выращиванием помидора, огурца и пшеницы. В течение 4 лет она имеет дополнительный доход от скотоводства. Ее муж помогает ей введение бизнеса.  Данное время она имеет 1 крупно – рогатого скота. Ее бизнес развевается год за годом, так как она постепенно усовершенствует свои знания, и развевает опыт. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 600 долларов США для покупки комбайна для сбора урожая, так как она выращивает пшеницу. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Dilorom is 51 years old. She is married and has one child who is 24 years old. Since she lives in a village, the main source of her family's income is agriculture and livestock. For more than 17 years, she has been growing tomatoes, cucumbers, and wheat. Over the last four years, she has had additional income from livestock. Her husband helps her to run the business. 

At the moment, she has one long-horn cow. Her business is developing year after year, as she gradually improves her knowledge and grows her experience. 

She is requesting a loan of US$600 to buy a combine for her harvest as she is growing wheat.

loans.use: to buy a combine for her farming business

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббату 53 года. Она замужем и имеет 2 сыновей и одного внука. Она добросовестная, честная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она родилась и выросла в сельской местности и поэтому имеет большой опыт по животноводству и земледелию. Ее сыновья выросли. Старший сын женился и имеет ребенка. Второго сына тоже надо женить и поэтому семья нуждается большому дому, но данное время у них маленький домик с плохим состоянием. Она хочет купить жилой дом для сына за деньги, которые отправил ей ее сын из России, где он зарабатывает. У нее не хватило денег для покупки дома и поэтому она запрашивает займ для покупки дома. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Muhabbat is 53 years old. She's married and has two sons and one grandson. She's an honest, good-willed and hard working person. Muhabbat was born and raised in the country, giving her a lot of experience with farming and raising livestock. 

Her sons have grown up. The older son is married and has a child, while the younger son is about to get married. Their house is small and in need of repair; Muhabbat wants to buy a large house for her younger son. Her first son sent her some money for this from Russia, where he works, but it wasn't enough. So Muhabbat is asking for a loan in order to go through with the purchase. She hopes for your help.

loans.use: To buy a house for her son.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 42 años de edad , es madre soltera de 3 hijos con quienes viven en una casaa alquilada desde hace un año.Desde los 14 años comenzó con el arte del bordado de prendas de manera manual, en especial de las faldas típicas de la zona, comenta que gracias a su buen gusto y al arte que heredó desde muy joven pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos y como madre soltera luchará para que logren ser profesionales. “Todos mis esfuerzos se centran en ellos, quienes se encuentran estudiando en la universidad”, comenta. Los meses de mayor venta son los días festivos ya que se celebra a los animales y los ganaderos utilizan las faldas típicas que elabora Carmen. Pero como buena mujer del campo también se dedica a la agricultura con la siembra de maíz, papa y verduras. Ahora desea mejorar sus ingresos y dinamizar sus ventas para poder educar a sus hijos. Este es el primer crédito con KIVA y agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante.Carmen invertirá los S/.2500  en la compra de hilos y telas de colores al por mayor para continuar sin dificultad sus bordados.
texts.en:
Carmen is 42 years old and a single mother to three children.  They have lived in a rented house for a year.  When she was 14 years old, she started embroidering clothing by hand, especially skirts that are typical of the region.  She says that thanks to her good taste and the art she inherited at a young age, she was able to raise her children and as a single mother she will fight so that they become professionals.  "All of my efforts are for them, since they are studying at the university", she says.  

The months where she has the best sales are festival days celebrating animals where farmers use the traditional skirts and cloths that Carmen makes.  As a good rural woman, she also farms corn, potatoes, and vegetables.  

Now she wants to improve her income and boost sales to be able to educate her children.  This is her first loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support that she receives to continue forward.  Carmen will invest the 2500 soles in the purchase of colored thread and fabrics at wholesale so that she can continue her embroidery without difficulty.

loans.use: to purchase colored thread and fabric.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Шарофат замужняя женщина, проживающая в районе Хуросон. Ей 36 лет и у нее две дочери 15 и 8 лет, два сына 13 и 10 лет. В данное время ее муж находится в России на заработках. Шарофат имеет среднее образование. Она вежливая и трудолюбивая женщина. Шарофат одновременно занимается  и растениеводством и животноводством. Она начала работать в этих сферах 8 лет назад и научилась этим ремеслам у своих родителей. Шарофат любит свою работу и получает хороший доход. Она за счет прибыли улучшает бытовые условия в семье. Ей в ведении сельского хозяйства помогают старший сын и старшая дочь. Она запрашивает кредит для земледельческой деятельности. На сумму кредита Шарофат хочет приобрести минеральные удобрения, повторные семена овощей, топливо, а также оплатить трактористу за вспашку земли.
texts.en:
Sharofat is a married woman residing in the Khuroson region. She is 36 years old and has two daughters aged 15 and 8 and two sons aged 13 and 10. Her husband is currently working abroad in Russia. Sharofat has a high school education. She is a polite and hardworking woman. 

Sharofat is simultaneously involved in growing crops and raising livestock. She began to work in these areas eight years ago and learned this craft from her parents. Sharofat loves her work and gets a good income. She uses the profit to improve conditions for her family. Her eldest son and daughter help her with the agricultural activities. 

She is requesting a loan for agricultural activities. With the loan, Sharofat wants to buy mineral fertilizer, seeds for perennial vegetables, and fuel, as well as to pay for a tractor driver to till her land.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizer, vegetable seeds, fuel, and to pay for tractor services to prepare the land

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru: Светлана родом из Мелитополя. Этот город находится недалеко от курортной зоны Азовского моря, где летом всегда отдыхает множество туристов. В течение года Светлана торгует на местных рынках своего города. А в летний сезон занимается выездной торговлей на побережье моря. Вот и в этот раз она планирует поехать работать в Кирилловку, предварительно закупив нужный товар. Светлана намерена использовать кредит в размере 21 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести сувениры, картины, часы, подарки и прочие мелочи на продажу в зонах отдыха туристов.
texts.en: Svetlana is from Melitopol.  This city is located near the Azov sea resort area, where a lot of tourists always come during the summer.  During the year, Svetlana sells at the local markets in her city, and is involved in traveling sales at the seashore during the summer season.  This time once again, she plans to buy necessary merchandise and go work in Kirillovka.  Svetlana intends to use the loan in the amount of 21 000 hryvnia to purchase souvenirs, pictures, watches, gifts and other small items for sale in the tourist resort areas.

loans.use: to purchase souvenirs, pictures, watches, gifts and other small items for sale in the tourist resort areas

loans.name: Irisali

texts.ru: Ирисали проживает в районе Хуросон. Ему 48 лет. Он женат и отец четверых детей. Ирисали честный и спокойный человек. Он занимается животноводством. Это ремесло ему передано от отца. Ирисали вот уж 9 лет продвигает это дело как бизнес. Он ни разу не жалел, что занимается куплей и продажей крупнорогатого скота. Ему в деятельности помогают сыновья и жена. Ирисали за счет разведения скота не только получает доход, но и обеспечивает семью  молоком и молочными продуктами. Он запрашивает кредит для приобретения трех голов бычков, чтобы увеличить поголовье продаваемого скота.
texts.en:
Irisali resides in the Khuroson region. He is 48 years old. He is married and is the father of four children. Irisali is an honest and calm person. He is involved in raising livestock. He learned this craft from his father. 

For nine years, Irisali has pursued this trade as a business. He has never regretted that he is engaged in buying and selling cattle. His sons and wife help him in his work. From his livestock, Irisali not only generates an income, but also provides his family with milk and dairy products. 

He is requesting a loan to buy three calves to increase the number of his livestock.

loans.use: to buy three calves with the aim of fattening and reselling them

loans.name: Jimmy Alberto

texts.es:
Don Jimmy Alberto es originario de Managua donde tiene veinticinco años de vivir junto a su familia, labora en una empresa del estado, donde se desempeña como agente de seguridad, desde hace tres años, tiene tres hijos a su cargo con edad escolar. 

Se presento a oficina de Ceprodel don Jimmy Alberto para solicitar un crédito para reparar el techo de su vivienda ya que tiene en cima el invierno, de este préstamo lo invertirá en compra de materiales  tales como  lamina de cinc ,perlin y pago de mano de obra. 

Agradece a Kiva- Ceprodel, por estos financiamientos que le brindan a las personas de escaso recurso, porque sin su apoyo no podrían salir adelante ya que tienen ingresos bajos, y no puede cubrir esta necesidad que se le presenta.
texts.en:
Sr. Jimmy Alberto is a native of Managua where he has lived with his family for 25 years. He has been working for a state company as a security guard for three years. He has three school-aged children.

Jimmy Alberto has approached Ceprodel for a loan to repair the roof of his house over the winter. He will use the money to buy supplies such as zinc sheeting and roof supports and to pay for laborers.

He is grateful to Kiva and Ceprodel for the loans they give to poor people as without their support people with low incomes would not be able to get ahead. Jimmy Alberto would not be able to pay for the necessary repairs to his roof.

loans.use: Repair the roof on his house

loans.name: Fidela

texts.es: Fidela, de 38 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Manuel y sus 3 hijos a los que cuida en casa de sus suegros desde hace 3 años. Su vida se centra en el trabajo constante y la educación de sus hijos. Comenta que su esposo trabaja en una mina, por lo que tiene una estabilidad económica. Pero como regresa de su labor después de 20 días, Fidela tiene gastos que ocurren eventualmente, por lo que pensó en la idea de abrir un negocio, es así que incursionó en la venta de comida en la feria ganadera semanal y donde acuden personas de todos los lugares para comprar vacas. “Me va bien, vendo la totalidad de mi comida y tengo buenas ganancias”, afirma. Es así que ahora se encuentra ahorrando dinero para abrir un restaurante grande, donde pueda preparar sus alimentos. Gusta de ser una mujer independiente y de afrontar los gastos que llegan en la ausencia de su esposo y sobre todo se encuentra feliz.Este es el primer crédito con KIVA y agradece el apoyo financiero para seguir adelante.Fidela, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos entre otros.
texts.en:
38-year-old Fidela is a hard-working woman. For the last 3 years she has lived in her in-laws' house with her husband Manuel and their 3 children who she looks after. Her life revolves around working constantly and her children's education. 

She says her husband works in a mine so they have economic stability. But since he only comes back from work after 20 days away, Fidela has occasional expenses which crop up, so she came up with the idea of opening a business. So she ventured into selling food in the weekly cattle market where people come from all over to buy cows. "It's going well, I sell all my food and I make good profits", she says. 

Consequently she is now saving money to open a large restaurant, where she can prepare her food. She likes to be an independent woman and take care of the expenses which occur when her husband is away and above all she is happy. 

This is her first loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support to move forward. Fidela will invest the S/.1000 soles to buy food supplies such as rice, sugar, milk and noodles among other things.

loans.use: to buy food supplies such as rice, sugar and milk and other items

loans.name: Mykailo

texts.ru:
Михайло имеет свой собственный магазин, где он продает товары для тома. Благодаря предыдущему кредиту появился новый вид товара - сантехника. И это помогло обрести новых клиентов. 

За последнее время покупная способность населения уменьшилась, и это отразилось на выручке. Михайло теперь более осмотрительно выбирает товар. Он старается  привозить новинки и товар  на заказ для определенного покупателя. Михайло хочет увеличить доход семьи, так как у него большая семья.

Михайло просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 21000 гривен на увеличение ассортимента товара - умывальников, унитазов, а тажке другого товара.
texts.en:
Mykhailo has his own shop where he sells wholesale goods. Thanks to his previous laon, he was able to add a new type of product--plumbing supplies--and this helped him to find new customers. 

In recent years, the purchasing power of the population has decreased, and this was reflected in revenue. Mykhailo is not more careful in choosing his goods. He is trying to bring new items and goods by request of specific customers. Mykhailo wants to increase his family's income because he has a large family.

Mykhailo is asking for a loan of 21,000 hryvnia to increase his product range: sinks, toilets, and other similar goods.

loans.use: to purchase washbasins and toilets for sale in his retail store

loans.name: Agneta

texts.ru:
Aгнета- 24-летняя молодая девушка. Она работает на заводе и живет вместе со своей бабушкой. 

Родители Агнеты жили бедно и развелись, когда она была совсем маленькая. Она начала рано работать и обеспечивать семью. Агнета ответственная, старательная и серьезная. 

Агнета просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 5000 гривен на проведение в дом природного газа. Топить дровами стало невозможно, так как бабушка слишком стара, а Агнета весь день на работе. Кредит поможет решить эту проблему.
texts.en:
Agneta is a 24-year-old young woman. She works in a factory and lives with her grandmother. 

Agneta's parents were poor and divorced when she was little. She started to work early and to provide for the family. Agneta is responsible, diligent and serious.

Agneta is asking for a loan of 5,000 hryvnia to install natural gas heating in the house. To use firewood has become impossible as her grandmother is too old and Agneta is at work all day. The loan will help solve this problem.

loans.use: to install heating in the house

loans.name: Lubov

texts.ru:
Любовь замужем. У нее двое детей. Она имеет свой бизнес.

На центральном рынке города Любовь  продает ритуальные товары. Она владеет киоском. Любовь всегда старается предоставить покупателям большой ассортимент. Она трудолюбивая, искренняя и открытая. 

Любовь просит предоставить ей кредит в суме 5000 гривен на закупку материала для изготовления венков.
texts.en:
Liubov is married with two children. She has her own business.

In the central market, Liubov sells ceremonial goods. She owns a kiosk. Liubov is always trying to provide her customers with a wide range of products. She is hardworking, sincere and open. 

Liubov is asking for a loan of 5,000 hryvnia to purchase materials for making wreaths.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to make artificial flowers

loans.name: Boldbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Boldbaatar, 45 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He has been selling and installing cable receivers for 15 years and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in this business. His main customers are in the countryside, and with each passing day, the number of clients is increasing. So he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase cable receivers in a large quantity. As a result, he can continue to render his cable television installment service without worrying about an inventory shortage. The borrower is a hardworking person who wants his children to get an exceptional education.

loans.use: to purchase cable receivers in a large quantity.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Edgardo, quien con su credikiva compró cemento blanco, granito blanco y negro, arena, cal y otros insumos, con los cuales fabricó lavaderos que vendió oportunamente. Él ha incrementado sus contratos de fabricación de productos y con ello cada vez mas brindará mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará  cemento blanco, granito blanco y negro, arena y cal. Una vez mas espera elaborar nuevos lavaderos que le permitirá incrementar sus ventas y aumentar sus utilidades, pues fabricará ahora para nuevos constructores que una vez conozcan sus productos se impactarán y lo referirán. Él envía un mensaje a los financiadores: “Gracias a la gente de Kiva por permitirme hacer crecer mi microempresa. “ .
texts.en:
Thank you for helping Edgardo who with his previous Kiva loan bought cement, black and white granite, sand, cal and other materials to make laundry sinks which he sold whenever the opportunity arose. He increased production allowing him to provide his family with a better standard of living. 

Once again Edgardo is hoping to make more sinks and thus increase sales and income. He will now make them for new builders who, once they see the sinks, will be impressed and give him a good reference.

He says, "Thank you, Kiva donors, for allowing me to grow my business."

loans.use: Buy cement, black and white granite, sand and lime

loans.name: Tekhèye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Tékhèye est un éleveur qui exerce le métier depuis plus de 10 ans. Il  vient pour la première fois solliciter un crédit de 300000F CFA pour faire de l’embouche bovine.
Il est marié et père de famille. Il travaille de 8h à 18h du soir et s’occupe particulièrement de l’entretien de ses bœufs. Grâce aux revenus de son activité, il gère la dépense quotidienne de son foyer. I l pense qu’en prenant le crédit, il pourra s’organiser plus dans son travail et dans sa vie et pourra épargner désormais tout en améliorant les conditions alimentaires des membres de sa famille.
Avec l’appui de l’IMCEC, il pourra augmenter le nombre des bêtes et y associer même les ovins et les caprins.
texts.en:
Monsieur Tekheye is a livestock farmer who has been in the business for over 10 years. This is his first request for a loan of 300000F CFA for bovine fattening.
He is married with children. He works from 8 in the morning to 18 at night and takes particularly good care of his livestock. Thanks to the income he earns from this business, he manages the daily expenses of his household. He believes that by taking out this loan, he could better organise his work and his life and thus save up money at the same time as improving the alimentary conditions of his family.
With the support of IMCEC, he could enlarge his herd and even add some sheep and goats.

loans.use: to buy livestock for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en: As a married parent of one child who is in school, Felicidad works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell salted egg business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Felicidad is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional trays of salted eggs to sell for her buy-and-sell salted egg business. Felicidad has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional trays of salted eggs to sell.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en: Magdalena is 57 years old and widowed with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Magdalena is borrowing 26,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 10 years. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream and to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 62 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Merlita has a business making dried fish in the Philippines. Merlita requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish for making dried fish.

Merlita has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Merlita would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish for making dried fish.

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Rodelyn has been in this business for 10 years. Rodelyn earns additional income from selling herbal medicines.

Rodelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money for business expansion in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Modesta works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling of rice grains in the Philippines. She also earns income from a general store and rice farming. Modesta is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her business.

Modesta has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Ndiogou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ndiogou est un vieux de la soixantaine d’année qui évolue dans le secteur de l’embouche depuis plus de 10 ans. C’est son passe temps favori car il travaille de 7h du matin jusqu’à 17h du soir. Il fait parti des premiers clients de l’IMCEC de cette zone, il est à son 8ème crédit, tous payés sans difficulté.
Il sollicite ce renouvellement pour renforcer son embouche, il pourra acheter  6 à 7 bœufs qu’il va emboucher pour revendre. Il pourra améliorer les conditions alimentaires de son foyer et mettre un peu d’argent de coté. Ndiogou vit des revenus de son activité, il gère la dépense quotidienne de sa famille.

 Ndiogou  possède un certain nombre de bêtes et son désir serait de maintenir ce stock régulier malgré ses ventes.
texts.en:
Mr. Ndiogou is an old man of about 60 who has been working in livestock fattening for over 10 years. It is his favourite occupation as he works from 7h in the morning to 17h in the evening. He is one of the first IMCEC clients in this area. This is his eighth credit, the others were all repaid without difficulty.
He requests this new loan to reinforce his business, he could buy six or seven bullocks that he will fatten up for resale. He would be able to improve his family's nutrition and save up a little money. Ndiogou lives on the income from his activity, he manages the daily expenses of his family.
Ndiogou owns a certain number of animals and he would like to keep this number stable in spite of his sales.

loans.use: to buy livestock for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Dúo Los Aposentos Group

texts.es: Dúo los Aposentos, este dúo esta conformado por la señora Alma Guadalupe quien se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario y a la elaboracion de tejidos tipicos, ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles y compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de tejidos tipicos.
texts.en: One of the two members of the Aposentos Duo is Sra. Alma Guadalupe who sells groceries and makes traditional woven fabric. She has been earning her living this way for several years and is now seeking a loan to buy more groceries and materials to make more fabric.

loans.use: Buy more groceries and materials to make woven fabric.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell fruits and root crops business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years. She earns more income from food vending and farming vegetables.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of root crops and fruits to sell. Merlita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of root crops and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Gantsolmon

texts.en: Mrs. Gantsolmon, 26 years old, lives with her husband and child in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. She began working as an accountant right after she graduated from her university. Her husband has been making and selling furniture for four years, and besides this job, he also makes Mongolian traditional gers. The house they live in is made with balks, and over the years, the house quality has deteriorated due to snow and rain. So she is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cements, planks, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, they want to encase balk walls with bricks and insulate them with fiberglass. As a result, the renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, release less pollutants and then contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 21 years, and she earns more income from selling fruits. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she is requesting a new loan to sustain her general store and  fruit businesses.
