Part of the profit she will be reinvesting in the same field and purchasing more varieties of groceries in order to provide better service for the customers. Another part will be used to cover the family's monthly expenses. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase grocery stock to open a grocery shop.

loans.name: Ablaye

texts.fr: Monsieur Ablaye est un homme qui évolue dans le secteur de l'élevage des moutons. IL a une expérience de plus 10ans dans son activité. Il est marié et père de famille, il pris en charges tous les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. Il est à son 3ème prêt et il n'a jamais eu de problèmes avec l'imcec. Il commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. Il a besoin de ce montant pour pouvoir acheter des moutons, les élever et ensuite les revendre pendant les fetes de tabaski et korité ou les moutons sont très sollités dans le pays . A l'avenir Monsieur Ablaye voudrait avoir un grand magasin de vente d'aliment de betail pour diversifier son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Ablaye is a man who has been active in the sheep raising sector. He has over 10 years' experience in the business.

He is married and a father, and takes care of all the family's daily expenses.

This is his third loan and he has never had problems with IMCEC. He starts his day at 8 am to finish at 7 pm.

He needs this loan amount to buy sheep, to be raised and then resold in time for the Tabaski and Korité festivities when sheep are very much in demand throughout the country.

In the future Mr. Ablaye would like to open a big store selling livestock feed to diversify his business.

loans.use: Buy sheep to raise and then resell them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inputs to help her coffee plants.

loans.name: Penda

texts.fr: Madame Penda est une femme qui s'active dans la commercialisation de tissus. Elle a une cantine au marché de la commune et a une expérience de 10ans dans son activité. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants, elle aide son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne et paye les scolarités de ses enfants. Madame Penda a besoin de ce crédit d'un montant de 100 000 pour augmenter ses revenus et acheter des tissus qu'elle revend au marché. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 18h. A l'avenir elle souhaite avec l'aide de l'imcec augmenter ses revenus et pouvoir acquérir d'un grand magasin et avoir le monopole de vente de tissus dans sa commune .
texts.en:
Mrs. Penda is a woman who is active in the marketing of fabrics. She has a stall in the communal market and has 10 years' experience in the business.

She is married and the mother of five children. She helps her husband in managing daily expenditures and pays for her children's school fees. 

Mrs. Penda needs this 100,000 XOF credit loan to increase revenue and buy fabrics she then resells at the market. She starts her day at 9 am to finish at 6 pm. 

In the future she wants to increase revenues with the help of IMCEC, so she can acquire a large store and develop a monopoly over the sales of fabric in her district.

loans.use: Buy fabric to be resold to her customers

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora María Mercedes  posee un negocio de venta Granos Básicos, ubicadas en unos de los más populosos mercados  de la ciudad león.

Ella inicia sus labores muy de mañana a las 5:00 am para ofrecerles a sus clientes las variedades de Granos Básicos como arroz, azúcar, aceites comestible, jabón, a su  clientela retirándose a hogar alas 4:00 pm para descansar, horario que lo ejerce de lunes a domingos.

El crédito que está solicitando a Ceprodel será utilizado para compra de 30 quintales de arroz el cual se lo están ofreciendo a buen precio y quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad para generar mayores ingresos mejorando así el nivel de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes owns a business where she sells basic grains, it's located in one of the busiest markets of the city of Leon.

She starts work early in the morning around 5:00 a.m. to offer her customers different types of basic products such as rice, sugar, oil, soap. She goes home to rest at 4:00 p.m. from Monday to Sunday.

The loan she is requesting to Ceprodel will be used to buy 30 sacks of rice which is being offered to her at a good price and she wants to take advantage of this opportunity to generate more income improving this way her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy rice

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a 25-year-old charcoal dealer in Likoni, Mombasa. He is a married man who supports four in his family and has been in this business for the last five years and has done well.

This marks his second borrowing from KADET LTD to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase sacks of charcoal and the anticipated profit to service his loan. He hopes to succeed in life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Pingdataaba Group

texts.fr:
Mme IRENE est  responsable du groupe PINGDATAABA. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 07ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. 01 va à l’école et elle a 04personnes en charge.
Mme vend des pagnes  depuis 11 ans. Elle s’approvisionne  à Lomé et au  marché du secteur 10. Ses clients sont les amis et voisinage.
Elle veut s’acheter30 pièces de pagnes, et 15 complets  Bazin.
Avec ses économies, elle veut améliorer son activité. Elle ambitionne toujours aider son mari dans la scolarisation des enfants et s’acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Mrs. Irene is spokesperson for the Pingdataaba group. She is in good health, married and the mother of two children. The oldest is seven years old and the youngest is three. One child attends school, and she has four persons to support.

She has been selling pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) for 11 years. She gets her supplies from Lomé and at the Sector 10 market. Her customers are friends and neighbors.

She wants to buy 30 lengths of pagnes and 15 outfits of Bazin fabric.

She wants to improve her business with her savings. Her continuing ambition is to help her husband with the children's education and to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy 30 pagnes and 15 sets of Bazin fabric.

loans.name: Birane

texts.fr: Monsieur Birane est un homme qui habite aux environs du Guichet. Il est marié et père de famille, qui évolue dans l'aviculture depuis plus de 2ans. Il a des clients dans le quartier et est très sollicité sur la vente des poulets de chairs. Il commence sa journée à 8h et la termine à 18h.Birane sollicite ce prêt d'un montant de 100 000F pour acheter des poussins et de l'aliment de volaille pour pouvoir effectué son aviculture. A l'avenir il souhaite augmenter ses revenus pour diversifier son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Mr. Birane is a man who lives near the branch office. He is married and a father who has been involved in poultry farming for more than 2 years.

He has customers in the area and is very much in demand regarding the sale of broiler chickens. He starts his day at 8 am and ends at 6 pm.

Birane is requesting this 100,000 XOF loan to buy chicks and poultry feed so he can run his poultry farming business.

In the future he hopes to increase his income so he can diversify his business and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: Buy chicks and feed for poultry farming

loans.name: Sonia Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Sonia Francisca Labora como Contadora en una empresa que se dedica a la venta de productos agrícolas ubicado en la ciudad de león.

Ella inicia sus labores muy de mañana a las 8:00 am a hogar alas 5:00 pm para descansar.

El  crédito que esta solicitando a Ceprodel será utilizado para Gastos médicos que incurrirá en un procedimiento quirúrgico(cirugía menor) y compra de medicamentos que necesita una hija que esta a cuido de ella y así mejorar su nivel de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sonia Francisca works as an accountant for a farming company in the city of León.

She works from 8am until 5pm every day.

Sonia is applying for a loan from "Ceprodel" to cover medical costs for minor surgery.  She will also use the loan to pay for medicines for her daughter and this will improve Sonia and the family's quality of life.

loans.use: to pay medical costs.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Martha Lorena  posee un negocio de venta Cosméticos y bisuterías, ubicadas en unos de los más populosos mercados  de la ciudad león.

Ella inicia sus labores muy de mañana a las 6:30 am para ofrecerles a sus clientes las variedades de productos cosméticos y bisuterías a su  clientela retirándose a hogar alas 5:00 pm para descansar, horario que lo ejerce de lunes a domingos.

El crédito que esta solicitando a Ceprodel será utilizado para compra de cosméticos, bisuterías, bolsos y carteras lo cual le genera mayores ingresos mejorando así el nivel de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena has a business selling cosmetics and jewellery in one of busiest markets in the city of León.

Martha begins work early in the morning, at 6.30am, to offer her customers a variety of cosmetics and jewellery.  She returns home at 5pm to relax.  Martha works these same hours seven days a week.

Martha is applying for a loan from "Ceprodel" in order to buy cosmetics, jewellery, purses and handbags.  This will generate a higher income and improve both her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, jewellery, purses and handbags.

loans.name: Flor De Rosas De Escoma Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE ROSAS DE ESCOMA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: artesanas de tejido de ponchos, venta de frutas, tejido de guantes y chalinas, venta ganado, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre a quien ayudó por seis años, posteriormente decide emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el incremento del capital (compra de ropa) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The "Flor de Rosas de Escoma" communal bank began will begin its first cycle with "Pro Mujer", through the Achacachi central office. The group is made up of eight members and is directed by a board, which is headed by the president, María. The members of the communal bank have businesses working in different areas including: selling fruits, cattle, meals and clothes and businesses making artisan ponchos, knitted gloves and scarves, and a grocery store.

This loan will benefit small businesses in the communal bank, of which María is a part. María tells us that this is her first time working with "Pro Mujer" and that she joined after one of the organisation's representatives came to visit her at her home. María currently has a business selling clothes and she tells us that she learned this trade helping her mother for six years.  It was after this that she started her own business. 

This loan will be used to increase her working capital by buying clothes at markets in the city of El Alto. María will then sell them at her own stall. This type of work allows María to earn money to support her household as best as possible. She is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about "Pro Mujer" María says that she likes the health advice that is provided, as well as the training for the loans.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Pedro Alfonzo

texts.es:
El señor Pedro Alfonso  posee un negocio de venta Granos Básicos, ubicadas en unos de los más populosos mercados  de la ciudad león.

El inicia sus labores muy de mañana a las 5:00 am para ofrecerles a sus clientes las variedades de Granos Básicos a su  clientela retirándose al hogar alas 4:00 pm para descansar, horario que lo ejerce de lunes a domingo.

El crédito que esta solicitando a Ceprodel será utilizado para compra de bloques, cemento, hierro, arena, piedrín para la construcción de una pequeña cocina en su casa de habitación y quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad mejorar así el nivel de vida de el y de su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro Alfonso has a business selling basic grains in one of the most frequented markets of the city of León.

He starts work early in the morning - at 5am - in order to offer a variety of basic grains to his customers, before returning home at 4pm to relax.  He works these hours seven days a week.

Pedro Alfonso is applying for a loan from "Ceprodel" that he will use to buy bricks, cement, iron, sand and gravel in order to build a small kitchen in his house.  He wants to take advantage of this opportunity so that he can improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bricks, sand, cement and gravel.

loans.name: Reina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Reina, requiere de un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo en su negocio de venta de ropa; este le permitirá comprar diversidad de prendas de vestir tales como: faldas, blusas, pantalones, vestidos, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a generar ingresos y esto lo ha invertido en los gastos del hogar; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Reina needs a new loan as she needs more working capital for her clothes selling business.  This loan with allow Reina to buy a variety of clothing items, including skirts, blouses, trousers, dresses and more.

Reina's previous loan helped her to generate an income that she used to pay household costs.  Her financial situation and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses, trousers, dresses and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cooking pots and other kitchen ware to fulfill the orders now that the summer party season is here.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 50 years old. She lives in Samtredia district with her husband George and son David. Valentina requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is George’s monthly salary. He is a director at the local school. There is only one source of income in the family and this is not enough to cover the basic needs of the members.

Valentina requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Valentina has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her credit Valentina will open an optical eye-wear shop. She has already found a place to rent and now needs to purchase stocks of products. She will work as a seller herself to decrease the expense of hiring somebody and paying them a salary. This will significantly increase her profit. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will give Valentina an opportunity to improve her family's living conditions and ensure a better future for them.

loans.use: To open an optical eyewear shop.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is an Iraqi client, who is 46 years old, married and has two children. Abbas is the sole provider for the family.

Abbas owns a grocery store and sells dairy products, canned food, juices and detergents. Abbas has been practicing this business since 2009 and has gained good experience in the field. Thanks to his affordable and competitive prices, Abbas became well-known the neighborhood.

Abbas is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD to pay the annual rent of his grocery store. Abbas is aiming to grow his business so that he may continue providing the best for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his grocery store.

loans.name: Tsitsino

texts.en:
Tsitsino lives in a small village, Okureshi, in Tsageri district. She is 57 years old and lives with her 29-year-old son David and retired mother in-law. Tsitsino requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Tsitsino is a nurse and she gets a a small monthly salary from working at the local hospital. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a milk cow and a pig. They sell dairy products and piglets. The family also owns a vineyard and plot of land, where nut trees are grown. David harvests the products and sells them together with dairy products and piglets on the local markets to earn a small monthly income. Their additional income comes from Tsitsino’s mother in-law’s monthly pension.

Tsitsino requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Tsitsino has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her credit Tsitsino will purchase 30 sheep. She will start selling lambs and adult sheep at the local market. This will significantly increase the family's income. With the increased income Tsitsino wants to develop her agriculture and earn good profit. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase 30 sheep.

loans.name: Arben

texts.en:
Arben is being photographed with this cute newborn baby lamb, in front of his animals’ stable :) 

He is requesting a loan to buy food for his animals.

Arben is a 42-year-old hard-working man who is married and has two school-aged children; fourteen and ten years old. They live in the suburbs of a little town, in the southeastern part of the country. Livestock is something that Arben has enjoyed doing so far and according to him, has proved to be a profitable practice. 

Milk is not the only product Arben has been selling on the local market; he’s been making and selling organic cheese and salted/unsalted butter as well. “I have different kinds of animals, but sheep are the ones I favor the most, because I find it easier to manage them compared to goats, pigs and cows,” Arben said with a smile.

loans.use: to buy food for his animals.

loans.name: Lucrecia Miriam

texts.es:
La Señora Lucrecia Miriam es madre de tres hijos de los cuales solo una está a su cargo inicia sus actividades a las 8:00 am ofertando lo que es electrodomésticos y finaliza sus labores a las 6:00 pm,  Ella realiza esta actividad para la mantención de su hija.

 Este crédito lo quiere para  utilizarlo  en la  compra de Relojs, Controles de T.V. y accesorio para celulares,   
Con dichos productos quiere satisfacer a sus clientes. Más en esta época del año.
 
Lucrecia  está agradecida por que sus créditos con ceprodel le han ayudado a incrementar su capital de trabajo ya que compra más barato sus productos de contado  y no de crédito, así ha logrado a realizar mejora en su vivienda y le brinda  mejor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Lucrecia Miriam is the mother of three children, only one of whom is still in her care.  At 8:00 a.m. she begins work which involves selling domestic appliances and at 6:00 p.m. she finishes her day.  This is how she earns a living to support her daughter.

She plans to use the loan to buy watches, TV remote controls and cell phone accessories.  With these products she will be able to satisfy customer demand, especially at this time of year.

Lucrecia is grateful for her loans through Ceprodel which have helped her increase her work capital and allowing her to buy less expensive products in cash instead of on credit.  She has been able to make improvements at home and give her family a more comfortable environment.

loans.use: To buy watches, TV remote controls and cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Patricia De Los Santos

texts.es:
La sñora Patricia de los santos madre soltera de 2 hijos posee un negocio de frutas y verduras  ubicada en la terminal de buses del departamento de león.

Ella inicia sus labores muy de mañana a las 7 am de lunes a domingo para ofrecerles sus productos  a los clientes retirándose a su hogar alas 5:00 pm para descansar.

El  crédito que esta solicitando a Ceprodel será utilizado para compra de frutas y verduras de la época como aguacates, cebolla, tomates, naranjas,  para así ofrecerle a su clientela una variedad de productos de mejor calidad para satisfacerles su demanda por lo que tendría más ingresos para mejorar su nivel de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Patricia de los Santos is a single mother of two children and she runs a fruit and vegetable stand at the bus terminal in the department of León.

She begins early in the morning at 7:00 a.m., working Monday through Sunday, tending to customers until 5:00 p.m.in the evening when she goes home.

The loan she is requesting through Ceprodel will be used to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables such as avocados, onions, tomatoes and oranges.  This will allow her to offer her customers a variety of quality products to satisfy demand, which will increase her income and improve her and her family's lifestyles.

loans.use: To buy avocados, sweet peppers, onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is 48 years old. He lives in Zestaponi district with his retired parents. Gocha requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. Gocha earns a living from agricultural activities. He has three milk cows and owns a vineyard and a plot of agricultural land, where vegetables are grown. Gocha has worked in agriculture from a young age alongside his father and is very experienced in this filed. He produces dairy products and sells them together with the harvested grapes and vegetables at the local market. The family's additional income is from Gocha’s parent’s monthly pensions.
 
Gocha requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Gocha has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Gocha will build a greenhouse. He wants to expand his agricultural business and start selling vegetables not only in summer but also in winter. For this reason, he will build a greenhouse and plant different types of vegetables. Harvested products will bring Gocha additional income. He is happy about having this opportunity to take out a loan in order to help his business move forward, which will help him to pay for all the household's expenses. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To build a greenhouse

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela is 29 years old. She lives in Samtredia District with her husband, retired mother and father. Lela requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of her low income and her family’s poor living conditions.
 
Her family runs an agricultural business. They have a plot of land, where nut and mandarin trees are grown. The harvested products are sold at the local markets. The family's additional income is Lela’s husband’s salary (from working at the local army base) and her mother’s monthly pension.

Lela requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Lela has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit, Lela will purchase a milk cow. She will milk the cow every day and produce cheese, which will be sold at the local market and Lela will increase the family's income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Lindita

texts.en:
Lindita is skilled at making embroideries and she loves it, as per her say :) She is a member of the vulnerable ethnic minority of Egyptian Albanians. She is a widowed mother of two children in their early 20s. She is in her early 40s. “Life turned out to be very tough on me and my children, with my husband passing away long ago. He was my support in everything and afterwards, I found myself not knowing what to do, unfortunately. And this is when my desire to handcraft came as a sort of revelation or out of my grief and desperation. Since then, I have been making such items and selling them to some Greek company. Not bad at all,” she ended.

Lindita is now requesting a loan to buy material for her craft embroideries.

loans.use: to buy material for her craft embroideries

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Condega un municipio conocido como tierra de alfareros por su artesanía y gente trabajadora, vive el señor Juan  en una comunidad aledaña con su esposa y su hijo al que tiene el deber de mantener y darles sus estudios , de profesión, agricultor, en granos básicos maíz y frijoles y la ganadería en pequeña escala.

conocido como una persona honesta y trabajadora, tiene 14 años de experiencia y trabajar estos rubros, trabaja junto con su familia en su pequeña finca de tres manzanas  que es alta mente productiva y quiere sacarle un buen provecho explotándola en uno de los mejores rubros de la zona como es el cultivo de maíz y frijoles, recientemente visito la oficinas y  está solicitando un crédito, para la compra de de abono, herbicida, fungicida más gastos de mano de obra.
 
Su proyección es cultivar dos manzanas de maíz y media de frijol y comercializarlos una vez que los coseche obteniendo un buen ingreso para cancelar y cubrir los gastos de su familia, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando en los nuevos ciclos agrícolas  y mejorar el nivel de vida cada día de su familia, ya que es su única forma de obtener ingresos.
texts.en:
Condega is a municipality known as the land of potters because of its craftsmanship and hard-working people.  This where Juan lives in a neighboring community with his wife and son who he supports and educates.  Juan is a farmer and grows basic grains such as corn and beans.  He also raises small animals.

He is known as an honest, hard-working man with 14 years' experience in this trade.  He and his family work on a small farm which is very productive.  He wants to take advantage of this and make it into one of the best corn and bean farms in the area.  He recently visited our offices to request a loan to buy fertilizer, herbicide and fungicide, and also hire workers.

His project includes growing two acres of corn and a half acre of beans.  At harvet time he hopes to receive a good income to pay off debts and cover household expenses.  This will allow him to continue working in new agricultural cycles and improve his family's lifestyle, since he is the only bread winner.

loans.use: To buy supplies (fertilizer, insecticide and fungicide, and to hire workers).

loans.name: Marella

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Las Palmas KM 14 se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Marella, tiene 62 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció, pero de esta relación tiene 12 hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes. Ella es modista desde muy joven, aprendió corte y confección en una Academia de esta ciudad.
 
Doña Marella es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma, desde hace mas de 15 años instalo un pequeño taller en su casa lugar en el cual confecciona todo tipo de ropa, lo que más le gusta es  hacer ropa de  mujer, ella elabora prendas nuevas o realiza arreglos con los cuales se gana algo para su sustento diario,  trabaja todos los días ya que actualmente está muy ocupada porque es época de entrada a clases y tiene muchos uniformes para confeccionar.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar telas, hilos, cierres y otros materiales que se requieren para la costura. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos para salir adelante. 

Sus sueños son que nunca le falte trabajo y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Palmas KM 14" meets every 15 days in the area of Montecristi which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and craftsmanship, both of which are nationally and internationally recognized.

This is where Marella, 62, lives.  Her husband died several years ago but they had 12 children who are now independent adults.  She has worked as a seamstress since she was young and she learned sewing at an academy in this city.

Marella is a very hard-working woman who likes to support herself.  Over 15 years ago she set up a sewing shop in her home where she makes all kinds of clothing but enjoys mostly making women's fashion.  She does both tailoring and mending of clothes to earn an income.  She works every day and is currently very busy because school will begin soon and uniforms will have to be made.

She plans to use this loan to buy fabric, thread, closures and other sewing supplies.  She is a founding member of the communal bank and enjoys receiving the support of the loans in order to get ahead.

Her goal is to stay healthy and have plenty of work.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, closures and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Emzar

texts.en:
Forty-six-year-old Emzar lives in the small village of Boslebi in the Dmanisi district with his retired mother, Zinaida. Emzar requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions.
 
His family owns a plot of agricultural land. Emzar is cultivating the land and planting haricot and potatoes. He is a very hardworking man and after harvesting the products, he sells them among the villagers and at the local market. The family's additional income is Zinaida’s monthly pensions. 
 
Emzar requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Emzar has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Emzar will purchase cheese at the wholesale price. He will smoke the cheese and sell it at a higher price to earn a good profit. Smoked cheese is very consumable in Georgia. As Emzar is already well known among the villager with his high quality harvest, he will have a good numbers of clients. Emzar will use part of the profit to reinvest in the same field and try to expand the business; another part he will use to provide better living conditions for his retired mother.

loans.use: To purchase cheese to smoke and then sell

loans.name: Tafaoga

texts.en: Tafaoga is a 35-year-old woman who is married with five children. She runs a business selling lollies, noodles, sugar, salt, etc in her community. She has five years of experience with this business. Tafaoga has requested a loan to buy a box of mutton flaps, chicken, sausages, snacks, boxes of herring, laundry soap, mosquito coils, seasoning oil, soy sauce and soft drinks. She plans to use her profits to extend their house. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to buy mutton flaps, chicken, sausages, snacks, herring, laundry soap, mosquito coils, seasoning oil, soy sauce and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Ubilda Elizabeth

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Primero De Abril se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Ubilda, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen  cinco hijas todas mayores de edad, una de ellas aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es abogado.

Doña Ubilda con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta y sentirse independiente  hace mas de 8 años empezó un pequeño negocio en su casa, el cual en la actualidad está muy bien surtido, ella tiene una papelería la cual es muy concurrida ya que esta justo al frente de una universidad que hay en la ciudad,  trabaja todos los días y en la actualidad le están ayudando dos y tres personas en su negocio ya que es la entrada de clases de escuelas y colegios y hay muchas personas en su local comprando las listas de útiles para sus hijos,  y en su papelería ya ellos  encuentran de todo y a muy buen precio.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar todo tipo de útiles escolares para surtir su negocio y aprovechar la época que  más se vende y más ganancias deja. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos requisitos. 

Su sueño es seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
The "Primero de Abril" communal bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi area, which is known for its rich, precolonial culture and its artisan crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally. It is from here that straw hats originate.

And it is here that Ubilda lives. She is 51 years old, married and has five daughters, all of whom are adults, with her husband. One of her children still lives at home.  Ubilda's husband is a lawyer.

Eight years ago, with the aim of earning some money on our own and feeling independent, Ubilda started a small business that she runs out of her home.  The business is now very well-stocked - she has popular stationery shop just opposite one of the city's universities.  Ubilda works every day and she currently has two or three people helping her at a time as classes have just started in primary and secondary schools and many people are buying the necessary materials for their children.  Ubilda's stationery shop has everything they need, and at good prices.

Ubilda will use this loan to buy all kinds of school materials to stock-up her business and to take advantage of this, the busiest and most profitable season of the year.  Ubilda has gone through two loan cycles with the communal bank and likes it because the loans are quick and do not have as many conditions as in other places.

Ubilda's dream is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy school materials.

loans.name: Mercy Marina

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Primero De Abril se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Mercy, tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 15 años que estudia en colegio. Ella vive con su hijo y una hermana que también es soltera.

Doña Mercy es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar honradamente para sacar adelante a su hijo, ella se dedica al comercio, vende productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). En su casa ella también se dedica a la venta de carbón, material que es muy utilizado por los negocios de comida,  trabaja todos los días ya sea en su casa o realizando sus recorridos. Deja a crédito  sus productos y cobra cada fin de semana, lleva en este negocio por más de 3 años y con esta actividad saca sola adelante a su hijo.

Este crédito es justamente para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 3 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es darle la mejor educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
The "Primero de Abril" communal bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi area, which is known for its rich, precolonial culture and its artisan 
crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally. It is from here that straw hats originate.

And it is here that Mercy lives. She is 48 years old, and a single mother to her 15-year-old son who is in school. Mercy lives with her son and one of her 
sisters, who is also single.

Mercy is a feisty women who likes to make an honest living so that she can help her son to get ahead.  Mercy has a business selling Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories).  At home, Mercy also sells coal, which is used a lot by catering businesses.  Mercy works every day, either at home or doing her runs for Avon.  Customers buy on credit and Mercy collects payments every weekend.  She has had the business for over three years and with it has helped her son prosper.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and imitation jewellery.  Mercy has been with the communal bank for three years and likes it because of the help that she receives through loans.

Mercy's dream is to give her son the best possible up-bringing.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and imitation jewellery.

loans.name: Zef

texts.en:
Zef is a villager from the rural north who has raised six children with his wife. He is in his late sixties but according to him, the physical work he and his wife have been doing from a young age and the fresh air they have been breathing, have kept them strong and healthy. “I come from a persecuted family and like the rest of my immediate and extended family, we truly suffered under the previous regime, but thanks God, for the freedom we found during these past years since the democracy. We are very grateful," Zef added. He works raising livestock.

Zef is requesting a 200,000 ALL loan to help build a new stable. His current stable, seen in the background of this photograph, doesn't look like a stable, according to Zef. He adds, "it is only covered with some cardboards and that’s it. It is very cold for the animals to stay in it during the cold and snowy winters, and way too hot in the summer. Staying and sleeping in a new and spacey stable, animals will love it,” Zef continued.

loans.use: to build a new stable for his animals

loans.name: Ligia Lilibeth

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Las Palmas KM 14 que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Ligia, tiene 22 años de edad, está casada y de esa relación tiene dos hijos de 9  y 4 años que estudian en escuela. Su marido es albañil.

Doña Ligia para salir adelante y con esto ayudar a solventar los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, ella tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa,  allí vende solo víveres, gaseosas y otras bebidas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su marido le ayuda en las noches. Tiene 3 años su tienda pero que con los créditos que ha recibido de la institución ella ha podido ir aumentándola y surtiéndola cada día más. 

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar toda clase de víveres. Está en el Banco Comunal 3 ciclos y le gusta porque con los créditos cada día mejora  su negocio el cual le permite sacar adelante a sus hijos. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus niños.
texts.en:
The communal bank Las Palmas KM 14 gets together every two weeks in the Montecristi Canton, which is known for its rich, pre-colonial culture and for its crafts, which are recognized both nationally and internationally. It is the place of the famous toquilla straw hats.

In this place lives Ligia, who is 22 years old, married, and has two children aged nine and four who attend school. Her husband is a bricklayer. In order to help out with the household expenses she runs a business, a small store in her home where she sells foods, soft drinks and other drinks. She works every day from 6 am to 8 pm and sometimes even later. Her husband helps her in the nights. She has run the store for three years, but with the loans she has received from the institution she has been able to expand it and stock it more every day.

She will use this loan to stock her store with all kinds of foods. She has been with the communal bank for three loan cycles and she likes it because the loans help her to improve her business every day and to bring up her children. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy foods

loans.name: Mwanaiki

texts.en:
Mwanaiki is a married mother who has made a living in sales for four years. She has a well-stocked cosmetic shop and is now requesting another Kiva loan. The previous one really helped her to continue growing and improving her business, allowing her to provide her customers with a good selection of products.

Mwanaiki wants to be able to buy more cosmetics and also establish a general store business by purchasing beverages, milk, meat, baked goods and other products so she can continue stocking her business and growing as a small businesswoman.

loans.use: purchase beverages, milk, meat, baked goods and other groceries

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married with three school-going children. She lives with her family in their own house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past three years, Mariam has sold fruits and vegetables from home to her neighbors. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

Mariam is requesting a 15,000 KES loan to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes to sell. In the future, she dreams of establishing a mini green grocery.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Kolotita

texts.en:
Kolotita is a 50-year-old married woman with nine children. For the past three years, she has operated a small plantation where she grows taro, yams, and bananas. Kolotita has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

Kolotita is requesting a loan to buy chemicals, a black-bag sprayer, fertilizer, and a wheelbarrow. She hope to use the profit from her loan to expand her plantation and help with the education of her kids.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a black-bag sprayer, fertilizer, and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is married and works hard to support her family. For the past two years, she has been buying and selling rice in the Philippines.

Amalia is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase rice to sell

loans.name: Lan's Group

texts.en:
Lan is 42 years old and married with two children. Her daughter has gotten married and her son is in 12th grade. Lan's husband is a driver who earns about 5,000,000 VND each month. For the past 10 years, Lan has been a farmer who earns about 1,000,000 VND each month. She also makes paper to earn additional money. Lan's family’s total income is about 6,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work is a lack of capital. She would like to breed chickens and her dream to ensure that her children can learn well and be successful in life. Lan is a hardworking woman.

Lan is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to buy food for chickens. This is her first loan with SEDA and she is a member of a loan group. Lan will use the profits from her loan to buy computers for her children.

Other members of Lan’s group include: 51-year-old Duyen, a farmer who wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND to breed chickens; 56-year-old Nguyen who wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to breed chickens and pigs; 33-year-old Lien is 33 who wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND to develop her work selling scrap metals; and 50-year-old Tan who wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND to develop her egg-selling business.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed

loans.name: Rami

texts.en: Rami is a 23-year-old single man living alone in a town in the Bekaa valley. He works as a painter in the construction and renovation field. He also owns an espresso machine, which provides him with extra income so that he can pay his education fees. He is enrolled in a technical school in order to gain more experience, improve his work skills, and satisfy his customers. Rami lives alone, which means he has to provide for himself everyday of the year, without any assistance. He has decided to acquire an Al Majmoua YOUTH loan in order to update his business tools and materials, and in addition, to be able to settle his college tuition fees

loans.use: to update his business tools and materials

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 19 years old and married. She has two children. 

She wants to start a small business making and selling pork cake in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy sack of flour, a box of chicken, dripping oil, soy-sauce, garlic, onion and a large cooking pot. 

In the future, Luisa hopes to help her family meet its commitments and improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy sack of flour, a box of chicken, dripping oil, soy sauce, garlic, onion and a large cooking pot.

loans.name: Suta Pertiwi Group

texts.en:
To continue having a good results, the Suta Pertiwi group requested another loan. The loan was used to buy chili seeds, bean seeds, cucumber seeds, watermelon seeds and others. 

To prevent soil depletion, they also provided a combination of chemical and organic fertilizers.

Wayan used the loan to buy fertilizer, agricultural tools and seed corn. Now is the right time to plant corn. He hopes the plan goes well. Wayan hopes cooperation between MUK and group Earth Suta continues so that the welfare of the farmers can be increased.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, agricultural tools and seed corn.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which is situated near Nairobi. She has four children and is a farmer. She has been doing this work for three years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Selling milk in the morning and mid-day" because she gets cash. Her biggest challenge is "When there is drought, If I get money, I preserve fodder." 

Animals on the farm have been given names. "'The goat is called Lydia; the cow is called Meni because of the white forehead."

Elizabeth was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Interest rate is low."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: "Developing a savings culture."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Elizabeth replied that when she sells eggs and milk she will be able to have more income and provide food and pay fees.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Elizabeth owns a cow, poultry, and a bicycle but does not own a pig, a pump, a motorcycle or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, solar power, and running water but does not have electricity, a sewing machine, a TV or a DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Marygorret

texts.en: Marygorret has applied for her third loan to finance her poultry business. She has expanded her poultry house and will purchase more day-old chicks for her farm to rear and sell later at a profit. She hopes to be a farmer rearing both layers and broilers in her farm and bring in greater profits.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks to rear.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 32 year-old married father of two children. He is a Palestinian refugee, which means he has really small opportunities and hopes for the future. He lives in a southern Lebanese town with his family. He has his own business in which he renovates houses and takes care of ceilings and floorings, and has been working in this field for ten years now. His wife is unemployed and his children are still at school, which means that he is the only financial provider of the family. 

Khalil contacted Al Majmoua because he needs a loan in order to purchase an electricity meter for his apartment, and also to settle the schooling tuition fees of his son.

loans.use: to purchase an electricity meter for his apartment and also to settle the schooling tuition fees of his son.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children. One attends school and is still under her care. They live at their rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a clothes-selling business. She sells at the market to her town dwellers and her neighbours. She cites her major challenge as the rate of stock turnover, which is affected by seasons. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a very hard-working and giving person, as her work is not easy. She operates a poultry business and now wants to establish a dairy farm business. Her husband is a businessman and they maintain their home and daily expenses through their work.

Florence asks for this loan in order to be able to acquire a milk cow that will help her to increase the sale of milk, and thus continue with the work they have been doing.

loans.use: to acquire a milk cow that will help her to increase the sales of milk.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a widow of sixty-two years. She has four children who are all adults. She runs a grocery store and also rears chicken in Kawangware. She has been in this business for 30 years and gets a monthly income of KES. 40,000.

This will be Teresia's eighth loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to buy tomatoes, onions, potatoes and one-day-old chicks to rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, potatoes, onions, etc

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 54 years old and married with eight children, two of whom are in school. Delia works very hard to provide for them.

Delia buys and sells charcoal in the Philippines. Delia has been in this business for 25 years.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

In the future Delia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rabie

texts.en:
Rabie is a 35-year-old married father of one child. He owns a small garage where he works in bodywork for vehicles. His wife is a housewife, which means that he is the only financial resource of the family. However, his income is not sufficient for three people living under the same roof. 

He decided to acquire an Al Majmoua loan in order to improve his business. He wishes to purchase old cars in order to renovate them and sell them on the market. As for the future, he wishes to purchase even more cars.

loans.use: to purchase old cars in order to renovate them and sell them on the market.

loans.name: Roin

texts.en:
Roin, 43, lives in the capital city of Georgia, Tbilisi, with his 42-year-old wife, Lela, and their 20-year-old daughter, Nino. 

Roin has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family business start-ups, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions.
 
Roin is working as a driver on a bus line. His wife is a cook at the local bakery. They both earn small monthly salaries, which are the only source of  income for the family.
 
Roin requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Roin has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Roin will purchase a car. When he has free time or a day offs from the bus line, Roin wants to earn additional income by driving the car as a taxi. He is a very hardworking man and doesn’t want to waste time. During his free time Roin will earn a good profit by driving locals in the town and will be able to provide for future studying for his daughter. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase a car and drive it as a taxi.

loans.name: Basima

texts.en:
Basema is 58 years old. She lives in Salt, Jordan. She is widowed and has a mini-market. 

Basema is also running a small business at home which is making decorative figures and pieces, and she is seeking a loan to be able to buy raw materials like polystyrene and other materials to expand this project and become well-known in order to earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like polystyrene and other materials

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti has run a store for over one year, and it is going very well. She says that she has a loyal customer base, thanks to her excellent service, in addition to being the best-stocked store in the neighborhood. This combination of factors means that she is enjoying lots of success.

She dreams of being able to continue to grow, so that she can earn enough to help her husband with the household expenses. She is requesting this loan to buy drinks, sugar, rice, flour and other items, as these are the best-selling products. She is grateful for the help she is receiving; it will be very useful.

loans.use: to buy drinks, sugar, rice, flour and other items, as these are the best-selling products.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in the Nkubu area of Kenya, which grows a lot of 'miraa', which can be chewed like tobacco. She has three children and has been doing agribusiness for 15 years.  Her primary income sources are eggs, tea, crops, and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: The returns she gets from her farm produce enable her to sustain her family. Her biggest challenge is 'Drought,pests and diseases.' Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Joyce was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Lower interest rate compared to others.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'They offer loans to farmers and repayment are made per monthly instalments.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family?' Joyce replied, 'It will enable my children to further their education.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Joyce owns the following: 'poultry, bicycle' but does not own 'cow, pig, pump, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, running water, TV' but does not have 'solar power, sewing machine, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: To purchase irrigation equipment

loans.name: Al-Akhwh Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Akhwh and consists of four women who live in Aden, Yemen. They strive to provide for their families. They applied for a loan of 250,000 YER from AMB.

Eftkhar joined this group and she is the leader, 39 years old, a married woman who works hard so as to provide for her five children who live in Aden. She has been selling clothing, shoes, and incense. Although she sells her products, the money she earns is not enough to cover household expenses and expand her business. so she applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB to buy ladies' clothes, shoes, and incense etc. All members hope to be financed in this loan to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, sweaters, shoes, incense, etc. for her business

loans.name: Karina Fernanda

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Primero De Abril se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Karina, tiene 21 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre y aun no tiene hijos. El marido es comerciante. 

Doña Karina es una joven ama de casa que cuida de su hogar y también se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa por catálogos y productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella hace los pedidos entrega y cobra cada 8 días ya que deja a crédito su mercadería, lleva más de 2 años dedicada a este negocio el cual le permite salir adelante. 

Este crédito es para comprar ropa  y los productos Yanbal. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 2 años y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que donde viven es arrendado.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Primero de Abril" meets every fifteen days in Montecristi, a town that is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its nationally and internationally recognized handicrafts. Home of the famous "Toquilla" straw hats (also known as Panama hats). 

This is where Karina lives. Twenty-one years of age, she is in a common law relationship and has not yet had children. Her husband is a businessman. Karina is a young housewife. She takes care of the home and also earns a living in sales. 

She sells clothes and Yanbal products by catalogue including beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories. She sells by going door to door. Every eight days she makes an order, distributes the products and collects payment because she sells her merchandise on credit. She has been in this business for more than 2 years and it has enabled her to get ahead. 

This loan is to buy clothes and Yanbal products. She has been part of the communal bank for 2 years now and she likes it because she began her business with her first loan. 

Her dream is to own a house because where they live now is rented.

loans.use: To buy clothes and Yanbal products.

loans.name: Jonaviv

texts.en:
Jonaviv owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

He has operated a book-selling business for the past three years. He sells in a shop to town dwellers, passersby and neighbors. He faces a major challenge of inflation in his business. 

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase more books for resale in bales. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase more books for resale in bales

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en:
Tamaz, 48 years old, lives in Tianeti district, Sioni village with his 47-year-old wife Tinatin. Tamaz requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Tinatin is working as a salesman in a second-hand shop on a small monthly salary. The family also has income from agriculture. In particular, they have chickens and sell eggs. Tamaz owns a shop, which is working only seasonally.  

Tamaz requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Tamaz has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Tamaz will purchase a stock of groceries to fill up his seasonal shop with products.  Sioni village is a summer tourist area and there are a lot of people during the summer. Tamaz wants to use the opportunity and open a grocery shop, which will work successfully during this period. He will work hard to earn a good profit and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase groceries to fill up his seasonal shop with products

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married and has three children, two of whom attend school. Her partner is a plumber. The two of them help each other with the household chores as they are both responsible for supporting their family. 

Mariam worked tremendously hard to set up her own business (a grocery shop) in her home. Mariam has a large and varied clientele because she offers very good service and sells plastic items, sweets and many other things. The loan she is applying for will be used to stock her shop with basic necessities, such as foodstuffs and soft drinks amongst other things, and will enable her to continue with what she has been doing so far.

loans.use: to stock her shop with basic necessities, such as foodstuffs and soft drinks amongst other things

loans.name: Symphrose

texts.en:
Symphrose is 34 years old and a tailor in Jomvu, Mombasa. She is a married woman who supports one sibling and her husband gives additional income. She has been in this business for the last ten years and has done great.

This marks her second borrowing from KADET LTD, to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase embroidery thread and a second overlock machine and the anticipated profit to plow back into her business. She hopes to grow her business and own a full boutique in future.

loans.use: to purchase embroidery thread and a second overlock machine

loans.name: Gibson

texts.en:
Gibson lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor running water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past few years, he has operated a food kiosk business, selling food such as maize flour and cooking fat to his neighbours and passersby. Gibson names the high cost of seasonality as his major business challenge. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan that he has applied for, he wants to purchase more goods such as maize flour, rice, beans, sugar and cooking oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food. 

He has been operating a tailoring business, making both men's and women's outfits. He sells at the market to local neighbors and passersby. 

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase  cloth, sewing thread and needles. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase  cloth, sewing thread and needles

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 35-year-old water vendor in Jomvu, Mombasa. He is a single man who has been in this business for the last three years and has done great.

This marks his third borrowing from KADET LTD, to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase a new water tank and open up a second water point and the anticipated profit to service his loan. 


He hopes to open several water points in Jomvu in future.

loans.use: to purchase a new water tank and open up a second water point

loans.name: Hamid

texts.en:
Hamid, age 52, is from Iraq. He is married and has four children. Hamid, along with two of his children, provide the family income together.

Hamid is a baker. Ever since he was a child, Hamid used to work in this field and since then he has gained much experience. In 2008, Hamid established his own business and opened his own bakery in the neighborhood, for there was no bakery in the area. For this reason, Hamid gained an excellent reputation and became well-known in the surroundings and now he has three hired employees.

Hamid is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to pay the annual rent of his bakery. Hamid is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may provide his children with a good future and a promising career.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his bakery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 30-year-old mother from Rodi Kopany in Homabay County which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married to Obunga who is a farmer in the same location. She supports six people in her family and has five children whose ages are 17, 15, 11, eight and six years old.

She sells cereals, a business she has been doing for the last three years and comfortably makes a monthly income of KES. 8,000. She has applied for her second loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more grains for sale. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

Her dream is to have a stable business and provide for her family.

loans.use: To purchase cereals for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 20 beehives and seedlings for cultivation

loans.name: Luke

texts.en: This marks Luke's fifth loan from KADET LTD to finance his business, after repaying the previous ones successfully. He will use the loan to buy additional stock of bicycle and motorbike spare parts, to facilitate purchases by his clients. He hopes to grow his business and open a  second shop.

loans.use: to buy more bicycle pedals, bicycle tires and motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in the Nkubu area of Kenya, located on the slopes of Mt. Kenya. She has two children and has been doing this work (agriculture) for five years. Her primary income sources are tea and crops. She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: “Being able to feed her family.” Her biggest challenge is “Drought.” Animals on the farm have not been given names. Rose was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: “Faster loan disbursement and reliability.” This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: “They support farmers in their financial needs.” Her highest monthly expense is for farming costs. When asked “How will this loan benefit her family?” Rose replied “it will provide better living standards.” As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Rose owns the following: “cow, poultry” but does not own “pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile.” Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household “mosquito net, solar power, running water, TV” but does not have “electricity, sewing machine, DVD.”

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase rabbits.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen is a married woman with one child who is still young. They live in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are for food for the family. She has operated a clothes-selling business, where she sells at the market to town dwellers and her neighbours. She cites her major challenge to be the rate of stock turnover, which is affected by the seasons. With the loan she is applying for, she wants to buy two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Kilifi, Kenya with her husband. She is 33 years old and for two and a half years, she has been operating a retail shop. She started the retail shop with her own savings. 

Susan learned about Milango through friends and she joined in order to access credit. Now she seeks a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy five bundles of maize flour, five sacks of rice and sugar, and sixty litres of cooking oil.

 In five years time she wants to open more shops to serve the entire neighborhood. She will save her extra income and start other projects to better her life. Her challenges are bad debts and the high cost of fuel and transportation.

loans.use: to buy five bundles of maize flour, five sacks of rice and sugar, and sixty litres of cooking oil

loans.name: Layla

texts.en: Laila was born in 1970. She has a family of five members and has a small project of selling cosmetics. Now she is seeking a loan to buy more cosmetics and make-up tools for her project, to expand it and get better income to improve their financial situation.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and make-up tools for her project

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is married and lives with her family in Likoni. She says that she received help from Yehu Microfinance in order to start her business. Thanks to this, she was able to set up a business selling fresh fruit. Owing to her determination and hard work, and her attentiveness, it grew rapidly. Currently, she has a solid customer base. The loan will be put toward the purchase of a refrigerator, for better conservation of her products. She is grateful to Yehu Microfinance for the help that she has received, as this is an excellent opportunity for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her business.

loans.name: Claris

texts.en:
Claris has operated a fruit and vegetable selling business selling at retail to her neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of bulkiness of goods hence high cost of transportation. 

 She appreciates the previous Kiva loan which helped her to boost her stock. Here again she comes to you for another loan of Kshs 50,000 to purchase sacks of fruit and vegetables  for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables and fruit to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron sheets to build a storage facility.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: This marks Christine's third time borrowing from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans successfully. She has done great and her business has grown. She will use the requested loan to purchase dry foodstuffs such as beans and rice for her food kiosk and pay school fees for her daughter who has entered secondary school with proceeds from the business. She hopes have a successful business which supports her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs for her food kiosk.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy operates a fish-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors thanks to the funds she got from Kiva. 

Here again she comes to you for another loan of KES 50,000 to purchase more fish to sell. She decided to join to acquire financial services for her business growth.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is married and her husband is a businessman, and they have three children. They live in Kisauni, Mombasa Kenya. 

Getrude has been a vendor for two years. She has a stall in the market where she sells fruits, vegetables, and novelty items. Her shop is well-stocked and she has an established customer base. She says that she started small when her children were still young. They get up very early to open their stall and to buy fresh produce so that they can offer good quality to all their customers.

Today she is requesting a loan to buy fruits and vegetables so that she can continue to offer her customers a good variety and to give them what they need.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Josyline

texts.en:
Josyline lives in the Nkubu area of Kenya, which grows a lot of 'miraa', which can be chewed like tobacco. She has one child and has been doing this work for 10 years. Her primary income sources are tea, eggs, crops and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Making a living from it' Her biggest challenge is 'Pest and diseases.' Animals on the farm have been given names.

Josyline was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'They provide low interest rates.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'We should not fear taking loans.'

Her highest monthly expense is business related. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family?', Josyline replied 'I will expand may farming hence get more returns.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Josyline owns the following: 'poultry' but does not own 'cow, pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power, sewing machine, TV, DVD' but does not have 'electricity, running water'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 63-year-old coconut fruit dealer in Kongowea, Mombasa. He is a married man who supports four children in his family; his wife brings additional income. He has been in this business for the last twenty years and has done great.

This marks his second loan from KADET Ltd. to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase coconuts for resale and will use the anticipated profit to service his loan. 

He hopes to have a wholesale business dealing in coconuts in the future.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Ararat

texts.en:
Ararat was born in the beautiful village of Lernadzhor which is in Kapan area. Till now he lives there with his big and nice family. Ararat is married, he has two daughters one of whom is married and lives separately with her family, and a son, who is also married and has two sons. Ararat’s father lives with them also and he is retired. 

For many years Ararat has had his own business; first it was a small stall, where he used to sell foods and different vegetables, but lately he has built a new shop which is bigger, more comfortable and with great variety of products of the first necessity. The place of his shop is convenient since it is along the route Yerevan-Tehran. And it is greatly and daily visited by tourists, villagers and passers-by. Ararat buys the necessary products for his shop from villagers and gets deliveries of different products from Yerevan wholesale markets.

Ararat is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy more products; meat products, juices, non-alcohol drinks, sweets, dairy products and household products for his shop. He hopes to receive a good profit from this deal and to increase the income from his business.

loans.use: To buy more products for his shop including meat, juices, non-alcoholic drinks, sweets, dairy products and household products.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a married woman and has been blessed with six kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She operates a poultry-selling business, which has been operational for over 12 years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. She dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy three cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a sack of sugar, three bundles of maize flour, four sacks of rice and Royce cubes.

loans.name: Smily

texts.en:
Smily is a married woman with one child. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She operates a food-making business, making consumables like beans and chapati (flat bread) which she sells to passersby and neighbours. She mentioned high cost of purchasing food stuff to be her major challenge. 

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items including wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Tufaa
